Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Reception area we were received by cordial staff. We then knew that we would be starting to get good vives about our stay. We stayed 2 nights. The room was very clean. Excellent breakfast by happy staff. Chef was very obliging. We will certainly stay there again. Noel & Helen

Reviews.Title: “Ewww”
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh_Elise_88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night (that was too much) Walked in put my phone on the bedside table there was a weird substance (pretty sure it was semen...) Opened the fridge it was hot, toilet kept running, aircon either broken or just crap. Dark, small, dingey and expensive (but I guess thats just Sydney city for you) Hotel refunded our money. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: bdoyle1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely situated in Pitt St near Goulburn St within walking distance of a block to the train , bus and three blocks from the centre of Sydney.There are plenty of shopping opportunities in close vicinity of the hotel and china town is just two blocks away. There are also clubs around that will allow entry to non members.The hotel serves breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms and amenities but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: toxified_blood
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the Easter weekend for 3 nights. It costed us an average of $165/night for a queen size bed. The room was Ok but could be better. We thought the room was small for the price. Cabinets inside the room reminded us of IKEA products. The wear and tear underneath the "renovated" surface was quite noticeable. A/C though working was quite old. wall control was already broken. The bathroom was annoyingly small. It reminded me of dongga bathrooms at mine camps. There was so little space to put things near the sink. I'm not that tall, only 5'10, but I'm unable to bend over inside the shower without hitting any of the side walls. I'm also able to easily reach the ceiling when I try to raise my arm. The floor tile inside the shower also need some proper cleaning as the middle part was obviously full of mold looking stains. Plus side is they allowed us to check-in early as requested - 8AM. and the location is very accessible. A walk away from most tourist sites in Sydney. Overall, the stay was OK. We're not really fuzzy with the little hotel details.. We're happy as long as it's clean, comfy, and price is reasonable. Photos are from Room 1001

Reviews.Title: “Location Good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Clubby74
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in Sydney at this hotel. Location excellent for Darling Harbour and about 15 min walk to Circular Quay/rocks. Also good for Town Hall train station. Hotel as expected for an Ibis functional and staff helpful. Felt it was noisy with traffic but not bad really.

Reviews.Title: “The joys of business travel”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl T
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Sydney to run a workshop we booked this hotel via the Accor website. Three workshops in three states over three days. We required and booked three rooms we were very disappointed to find one of our booking had apparently disappeared problems with the computer was the explaination, it was around 7.30pm when booking in. The staff informed us the hotel was full. They did ring around other Accor hotels however after 30mins they eventually decided to offer us a shared room with two beds. The rooms were very small, the air conditioner was discoloured and the ducts covered in dust, walls marked, carpet marked. The bed and linen was satisfactory. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Various small issues but still OK overall”
Reviews.Author: glennomeister
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here once or twice before this time and had a very good impression. However this time things weren't quite as rosy. The main thing driving me mental is the shower, it's small, the soap tray is not good for the type of small round soaps provided because it slips through the grill so easily, and it is placed in about the worst place it could be and I was forever knocking into it with an arm (or shoulder when standing back up after picking up the soap!). It was also loose - no doubt because others keep knocking it as well. The fridge door had one arm basically broken - it stays shut OK, but when you open the door it basically slumps out and down. I noticed noise from other rooms, not really bad but a bit more than I'm used to. A couple of other little annoyances that I can't remember now. On the plus side, it's in a very good location, and it's the best value of the Accor hotels in Sydney. So it gets 3 out of 5 for being good value overall, but no more than that because of the annoyances. As mentioned by a previous reviewer, you have to pay for storage if you are checking out but want to leave your luggage for a while, but $7 for up to 24 hours is OK, you can't expect lots of freebies from what is essentially a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money, No Matter What You Pay.”
Reviews.Author: BluesTraveler75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little run down. The service is OK but you can see upon arrival that this hotel needs some paint and upgrading. For the price I paid it was a disappointment. The only upside was the location, in the heart of Sydney, close to the train.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: TigerTiger73
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel at short notice due to a concert I was going to at the Sydney Entertainment Centre. I stayed in a standard queen room on the 17th (top) floor. My room was small, but very clean and comfortable. Location was fantastic, handy to great restaurants, trains, buses, shopping. I was surprised at how quiet it was. Outside noise was not a problem. I drove to Sydney, so parking was $35 per 24 hour period, but I had to leave my car in the Carpark for the whole 2 days I was there, as taking it out incurred extra charges. I didn't need the car, so this wasn't really a problem. The hotel staff were very friendly, and I loved the free daily magazines. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: eternalquest23
Reviews.Content: A/C was not working but they changed me to another room with no problem. Room was clean. Bed very comfortable. Great location close to transport. Nothing fancy here but clean and comfortable for a night or two. Although on arrival staff service not good at all, but dealt with others and they were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: weekend-escapist
Reviews.Content: Very friendly helpful staff. Room was standard no frills but very clean and bed comfy. Located on busy Pitt Street however, my room was quiet. The only draw back for me was not having a restaurant or room service evening meals, although the hotel is situated in an area of asian restaurants, I prefer when travelling on business to be able to eat in the hotel. Breakfast was very reasonably priced at $15 however there may have been problem with the bain marie as the hot food was cold. Over all I think the Ibis provided good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: female-tourist
Reviews.Content: I sent an email saying I would be arriving early, and at 8.30am I arrived and my room was ready. The room was rather small and basic, but clean and good standard. It contained a fridge and tea/coffee maker. This hotel is on the corner of a busy street, but my room was on the 8th floor and very quiet. Staff were very pleaseant and helpful. Very limited "food" service - only a few snacks - but plenty of restaurants in the area. This area is close to transport and many attractions so is a good base for touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Acor Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the world square several times..I like the location. The room in egenral was fine. However. The ironing board in the room I stayed in was very flimsy, and I had to hold it with one hand as I ironed with the other. It looked like it had been repaired badly. It may seem like a small thing, but as a business traveller ironing shirts and so on is very important to me. I just anted to let you know.

Reviews.Title: “Feedback”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For what amenities were on offer and the size of the rooms (a little small) I think that $239 for 1 night was a bit expensive. I travel quite regularly both in NSW and interstate and for a room of this nature (it was a bit dated) I would expect to pay somewhere around $150 for just a room for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. It is close to everything in the CBD of Sydney The staff were very helpful and nice at all times. The room was comfortable and clean but need a bit of an update. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay and rooms modern”
Reviews.Author: colin_morrissey
Reviews.Content: enjoyed stay here compared to other budget hotels was great. Location is perfect , only a few minutes from Darling harbour and shopping streets , would stay again, staff were great and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay for single guest”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I thought the room to be small but comfortable and adequate to my needs and air conditioning was fine - it was what i expected from the Ibis brand of hotel. However, i must compliment the booking and reception staff who were all very efficient, courteous and very helpful compared to the service i have received at my stays at more expensive hotels

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra W
Reviews.Content: My family stayed only 1 night thankfully, our double room was very small, and filthy. The bathroom had mold in the shower, shower floor could have done with a good scrub, grout was white in places, but mostly black. Hair was on the floor in the bathroom. Dust was very thick around the door frames, in fact it was past the dust stage. When we booked it was for 2 rooms, 1 a double, and the other for 2 and a child, but on arrival reception did'nt have the details, thank goodness we had paid to prove we'd booked for that number. As it was for only 1 night we stayed, but booked another place for our return. It did feel more like a backpackers, dinning room needs a good upgrading, but the breakfast was very good. Both families would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, not fantastic by any stretch and basic facilities. Gym and breakfast areas poor. Definetly in need of a spruce up. However I half expected this type of hotel when considering pricing options around Sydney and in the same loco.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: rattusp r
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Ibis World Square for four nights and found the rooms to be quite small and filthy. There was mould in the shower and the floors were slippery like they needed a good clean. Each time room service replaced the tissue thin towels they were either frayed or ripped, one even had a stain on it. The cleaners insisted on placing a disgusting red fluffy pillow on the bed everyday even though i kept taking it off, those pillows need to be burnt for health and safety reasons. I have stayed at the ibis in Brisbane before and in comparison the Ibis World Square is like a backpackers lodge. They charge a rather steep $4 per half hour or $7 per hour (that's a one dollar saving) for internet usage which in these times I think should be free especially because this hotel has nothing else to offer except for vintage air-conditioners and a great location (which they keep telling everyone about in response to their complaints). The walls are as thin as their towels. I could be here all night with my list of complaints. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my mortal enemy. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “westcoaster”
Reviews.Author: kevin b
Reviews.Content: Everything was good. However the standard rooms are very small for two people.Would not stay again in a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: lindylovesaholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights prior to goining a cruise. Firstly I would say that the hotel needs to update it's website as the price for a taxi and distance to city is incorrect. On arrival at Sydney airport we watched a short video on the plane giving transport methods and prices into the city. A taxi was quoted at $40 which in fact was slightly more at $43 We had a room on the top floor which was nice & quiet, the air-conditioning was very effective and the room was clean if a little small. We only ate breakfast once but what we had was good and plentiful. The hotel is within walking distance of Darling Harbour and slightly longer to the Harbour Bridge and the Rocks area. Plenty of shops/Bars etc within walking distance. The staff were very pleasent andefficent and got a couple of maintenance issues rectified within the day..

Reviews.Title: “not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Sophie F
Reviews.Content: The location is great, however that was the only good thing about the hotel. Firstly we arrived at 10am, too early to check in so we asked if they could hold our luggage, we were told we needed to pay $7 for a locker. I've stayed at a lot of hotels and have never had to pay to store my bags. Also the room we were given smelt revolting, like stale smoke. The rooms are tiny, and outdated making them uncomfortable, also it was very noisy. We asked to be moved due to the smell and were given another room which didn't smell but was also tiny. We also asked for our money back for the next 2 nights so that we could stay somewhere else and were told they couldnt because we'd already payed. The staff were unfriendly, and after asking numerous times finally we were able to get our money back and moved to a different hotel. Usually i dont complain but think other people need to be aware of this hotel. I wouldnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “aircon”
Reviews.Author: ralphb37
Reviews.Content: air conditioner was useless plus the response to the complaint, was told 3 days on the trot "we have someone coming to look at it" they must have looked and walked away, we werte given a fan on the last night ,third and last visit $591 for 3 nights could do a lot better

Reviews.Title: “Good location, below average offer”
Reviews.Author: Finntravel
Reviews.Content: Location is very good. Monorail, bus and train services by walking distance. Big shopping mall other side if the road and plenty of good restaurants in same block. Breakfast is minimalistic and not for people who value healthy food. If you'd like to avoid fat and unhealthy food, you basically can drink water and eat watermelons. That's all. Price AUD20. No vegetables except fried tomatoes. No restaurants in the hotel. You can order simple food from the reception. However, many good restaurants outside the hotel just few steps away. It has been now 2nd day without working aircon. Rooms are shabby, with inside aircon. Tv remote working poorly. Expensive but fast Internet connection. Difficult to control shower water temperature. No swimming pool even that has been mentioned in them website. People are nice in the hotel and they help you in the reception. Definetily not more than 3 star hotel, I'd rate them 2+ or 3- gategory. I'm traveling 100 days per year around the world and I know what I'm talking.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews say!”
Reviews.Author: tommypee1
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. Location is propably the best there is. It's couple of minutes from Museum Train station, lot's of bus stops, shopping mall across the street with a large grocery store and just couple of minutes walk to Cockle Bay, Chinatown etc. Hotel is located in a one way side street, so the traffic noises isn't so bad. But still, as central location you will find some cars and people around your hotel. Hotel service is better than average australian service. I really liked it. Rooms were cleaned every day. Room isn't small nor big. It's a basic central location sized room. Furniture must have been renewed recently. The only negative thing I can find is the out dated bathroom. It still delivers, but it's old. If I return to CBD Sydney, I will definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, tired room”
Reviews.Author: JustJessPerth
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was in the perfect location for my purpose the room was tired and poorly kept with mold in the Shower and Vanity and the drains in desperate need of clean as there was an odor that was only present when water was flowing down such as when I was showering. The worst aspect of this place is possibly an Ibis issue and not just World Square. It is my first time ever using an Ibis Branded hotel. I checked out on the 15th of January after settling my account correctly. I am now aware that there is a hold on the cost of 1 nights accommodation plus 50% on my visa DEBIT card (so my money and not the banks) that will not be lifted until the 29th of February without a letter from the hotel faxed to my bank! Excuse me it takes 6 and a half weeks for the staff at the Hotel Ibis World Square to work out if you have used something from the minibar, unlike 2 - 3 hours like any other establishment. If the location is what you are looking for and you are spending all day out of the hotel than this is place for you, if you are looking to relax in your room or are on a limited budget and cant afford to have the total cost of your accommodation plus held for 2 - 6 weeks then find an alternative

Reviews.Title: “helpful people and central”
Reviews.Author: tumgok
Reviews.Content: central location, the people are very helpful in the hotel. would stay again. linen very clean. able to book there and they tell you good advise.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Joketravel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, however pictures of outside of the hotel misleading. Friendly and helpful staff.Rooms were small but sufficient. Every thing in the room was very clean. There were some great Spanish restaurants and tapas bars around the corner. Great food and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: The_Agent2012
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights stay at this property. The hotel is located in the best location, plenty of good restaurants and pubs around. Room are small but adequate for a couple. Highly recommend for budget travellers.!!

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing”
Reviews.Author: susanna142
Reviews.Content: I'm finding it difficult to say anything truly positive about this hotel. The entrance is just a doorway near the corner of Pitt and Goulburn streets and very easy to miss. Being a business trip and therefore arranged and pre-paid by company, we were surprised to be told we needed to give them a security deposit and photocopy of identification before they would allow us to check in. The man at reception insisted on this. As I was with two other female colleagues, we asked for rooms close together on the same floor. This was arranged and then this man "announced" that my room number was 603 on the 6th floor loud enough for anyone in the tiny reception area to hear. I requested that we be given different rooms and he write down the room numbers instead of telling us in his loud voice. Rooms are small/stuffy, TV is attached to the wall, tabletop/tiny wardrobe pre-fab and also bolted to the walls. Air conditioner is badly positioned above the bed. Bathroom is also tiny, smelt mouldy and shower not sealed well resulting in flooding. Breakfast is adequate although tinned fruit is offered, not fresh. We signed for $20.00pp breakfast fee to be charged to rooms and found we had been charged $35.00pp upon checking our final account. Overall, not a happy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: shower curtain had mould, the floor of the bathroom flooded when you showered. the shower head was not tight, and therefore did not sit up straight. The room was right across from the elevator on the floor that housed the breakfast restaurant - in the AM lots of noise and traffic. The ladies at reception were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “5 days in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception staff very helpful. Appreciated late checkout.. A special comment. We left bags for an hour after checkout and when we collected them, the man at reception noticed we were hot and gave us each a bottle of cold water to take with us. A very thoughtful gesture that we very much appreciated.That small thing left me with a positive feeling about our 5 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectation”
Reviews.Author: Rika P
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during a weekend in December. I was travelling with my partner. The check-in process took so long and when we got into our room, it was quite disappointing. The room was a bit cramped and its furnitures were outdated. But the room was clean and staffs were helpful in showing us the way around the CBD. The location is very good as it is near to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but service is pathetic”
Reviews.Author: Michael Z
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for New years eve back in Feb 2011. At this point i was travelling with three mates and requested 4 single beds. Upon arriving into the hotel we checked in and the room had two queen size beds...clearly not what we wanted. Brought it to the duty managers attention and he advised he would arrange to have the beds split as we requested. We came back after 40 mins and noticed that only one of the queen size beds was split. Obviously second time around still couldnt get it right. I called reception again and advised we still have an issue, so the gentlemen decided to transfer us to level 2 where the "room was ready". Not the case, we had to wait another hour for our room to be ready. What gets me is that i have an email from the reservations department clearly stating we booked and paid for 4 single beds over 9 months ago...and the duty manager still insits they are not responsible. I asked for compensation for all the mucking around,,, and all that was offered was a lousy $20 breakfast on the house. I still dont recall even recieving an apology, my motto is if we pay something i expect to recieve it. What i have decided to do is make a complaint with consumer affairs as i believe the compensation that was provided dosent complement the inconvience we experienced. The only thing i enjoyed about the hotel was its great location smack bang in the heart of sydney. The rooms were okay...but the bathrooms are pathetic, everytime you take a shower you literally have a pool of water around you....whoever designed the bathroom needs to rethink design with logic.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square”
Reviews.Author: Woolies Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this accommodation direct with the hotel. Wonderful service from the staff. and awsome location and in walking distance to everything.Bus, train and near to Chinatown and Paddys markets. an easy walk to Darling harbour and Chinese gardens. Very close to the tram station to the casinoas well. Just loved the stay

Reviews.Title: “To enjoy a night out in the City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What more could you want from this hotel. Location is perfect, heading for a night out you can walk to anywhere or its a cheap taxi ride for those ladies in high heels. There is an inhouse bar to have a few drinks with friends in teh lobby before heading out that it also reasonalbly priced wtih some locally made beer. Breakfast can set you up for the next day and a generous 11am checkout allows that little sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “3-4 Stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The worst Sofitel i stayed in my past ,if compare to other cities or coutries like UK,Bangkok,China and etc. I will not come back to this hotel again.Even Hotel Ibis,Mercure or Novotel better than here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Ibis World Square at least 20 times in the last 4 years and their level of service, quality of their rooms and value for money on each occassion has been exceptional. Located in Pitt Street - close to Central Station, the Capitol Theatre, Paddys' Markets, Cockel Bay etc as well as the movie theatres. It is also an easy walk to Pitt Street Mall and beyond to the Quay. This place is always my first choice when staying in that end of town.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: Mel_K_11
Reviews.Content: Look, we were looking for value and this served the purpose. The staff and cleaning staff were lovely, the rooms were adequate but the TV was awful. Analogue. Terrible selection of channels. I couldn't watch as the reception was awful

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Accor staff member staying for leisure with friends, overall good, reception staff on check-in friendly and no issues, he confirmed the rooms booked as one was twin and the other was double. He also knew where nearby Italian restaurant was, which was convenient. Breakfast staff could be a little brighter and happier otherwise no issues . Checkout issues concerning breakfast seemed an issue. I had booked on-line with discounted breakfast option, however no recognition of breakfast within my reservation seemed to be noted. This added to the delay in checking out. Finally sorted but also noted other guest beside me checking out was having a similiar issue with breakfast option booked on-line. Good place in relative close proximity to most things.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, AVERAGE ESTABLISHMENT”
Reviews.Author: Hanktank4 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, rooms were average, ensuite small. Took 2 days to get an extra pillow. Servicing of rooms was average, one day cups not washed, wife's pajamas thrown on the floor, towels left on the floor to be changed hung up again. Parking, one entry, one exit $35.00 per 24 hours, or valet parking at Rydges with muliple entry/exit $50.00 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Jen520
Reviews.Content: Small Room, the window cannot be open and the air-condition is quite old. The room got the smell and the bath room is really small. when the bathroom door opens, you cannot go pass the lounge.Narrow Space!!!!! Customer service is fine (reception). Thick dust on the desk. Not really pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We got really good rates on this room because they had a deal on that we received in an email, so for the amount we paid it was great, the rooms are pretty basic but its a really good location, staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAY EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very short but sweet stay and really enjoyable, brilliant views, excellent service, relaxing atmosphere, what more could we ask for! Definitely recommend to everyone else if they wish to have the best stay of their lifetime :) Thank you Novotel

Reviews.Title: “Ibis stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a clean comfortable room with the staff very helpful. Is in a great location in Sydney walking distance to shops, China town and Darling Harbour. Rooms are small so great if you are only using the hotel as a base at night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very small. Airconditioning didn't cool. Breakfast was very average, coffee disgusting - automatic machine, eggs fried only and over cooked, bacon undercooked - very pink, etc, etc. I would not go back. Over priced for what you get. I will stay at Rydges, almost next door, next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Ibis World Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this was our first time at this hotel. It was a good central location for our requirements. the room was small but the bed was comfortable and it was quiet. The staff were very friendly. So overall we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Week in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Ibis World Square was great. The venue is centrally located and is an easy walk to railway stations, Darling Harbour, Paddys Market or CBD & Hdye Park, Great range of shops near by or again with in walking distance. Likewise restaraunts are abundant catering for various cusines. Found the staff to be friendly and the rooms very clean and tidy,

Reviews.Title: “Budget but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay of 16 nights (Nov/Dec) for business was OK. However my room was very small with a dull view for such a long stay. Nevertheless it was clean and the front of house staff were efficient and attentive. On the week-ends it was very very noisy. Noise coming from outside through a slatted ventilation opening leading directly into the corridor by my room. Definitely a short stay traveller hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: komsAustralia
Reviews.Content: Early December 2011, my husband and I stayed at this hotel recently. The staff were very friendly and helpful (especially George) on our arrival. Check in was quick but no early check in was allowed. Our room was on 15th floor and it was pretty quiet. We didn't hear the lift or the traffic outside which we were greatly pleased. The only noise was coming from the room next door occupied by Chinese tourists. (They are always loud.) Unfortunately our room was very small and basic with average (scuffed and tired-looking) facilities in the room. Having said that our bed was comfortable and we had a good sleep. Our bathroom was big enough butâ€¦ whoever designed the shower cabin had a Lilliputian in mind. It was almost impossible to turn around in it when inside the cabin. Claustrophobic! The other thing that was not really nice in the bathroom was the toilet seat. The seat was the wrong size for the toilet. Be careful not to pinch your bottom on it. The other thing to be aware of is if you are travelling with big suitcases the wardrobe is not big (not wider than 50 cm I think) with the iron board hidden inside. The iron also hangs on the wardrobeâ€™s internal wall. There is definitely not enough space in the wardrobe. The walls and door would benefit from a fresh lick of paint as they are scuffed. As in the other hotels, complimentary coffee and tea are provided. But it looks like the Ibis management made sure to be economical and only allocated one tea bag per person per day and even less sugar. I do not think one sugar sachet per room is enough. It would be nice if the hotel provided more sugar and coffee and perhaps a tea selection, green tea, like other hotels do. Unfortunately there was another thing missing- a toothbrush. Most hotels usually provide a complimentary toothbrush. There were also not enough towels. Just two face washers and only 2 thin and shredded/ frayed towels were provided. I do not think that this is enough. The towels were so worn and thin that they were still wet when you wanted to have two showers during the day. To finalise the hotel don't provide free luggage storage for customers. If you are with big luggage and you have a late flight you have to pay $7 for a daily locker. Just as well we didnâ€™t need it. Anyways, generally speaking the hotel was good and cheap for a Sydney CBD hotel with a great location. It is located almost in the heart of Sydney. Its location is perfect and you can readily explore Sydney from it. It is within walking distance to the main rail station and definitely in walking distance to the most visited tourist sites: Opera House less than 1 km, Queen Victoria Building approx. 500m, Pitt Street shopping mall about 1km, Hyde Park approx. 300m, The Rocks less than 1km, Chinatown approx. 800m, Darling Harbour about 1,5km, And there are plenty of food places around. We would stay here again just for the good location. PS. After checking out you should check your bank card account. The problem we experienced is that Ibis charged our card AUS $ 50.75 for deposit + bank fee (??). It is 5 days after our check out and this problem still hasnâ€™t been resolved. This amount is still showing. I must add that we paid for our room long before we arrived to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very average example”
Reviews.Author: SurfingGiraffe
Reviews.Content: Yes, Ibis is one of Accors cheaper brands but this is a very average example. The rooms are small, my bed was uncomfortable and generally the place felt a bit tired all round. Obviously housekeeping don't check everything too closely as it took me a while to figure out that the TV wasn't working because it was switched off at the wall. Front desk staff were pleasant and friendly. Locaton-wise close to Chinatown and plenty of eat/drink options. Overall I think there's better around for similar or only slightly more money.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Sydney square Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good for business traveller as it is simple, clean and near to my customer place and it is also very near to restaurants and a shopping mall. The only thing i hope the hotel could improve is to provide bottled water in the rooms as it would bring more convenience to the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room was a bit small but it was perfectly adequate for our short stay and did not cause us any inconvenience. Apart from that the title of this review says it all! We highly recommend a Nepalese/Indian restaurant called The Muglan which is very close to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Just dont expect any sleep..”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is the only good thing about this hotel, and its average value for money. I will never return to this hotel. It is not designed for patrons to get any sleep. The sheer noise that you can hear from you room is astonishing... 14th Floor, you can still hear people on the street talk, as if they were in the next room. Plus why put a very loud "Ding!" on the Lifts. It echoes through the entire floor. ALL NIGHT!!! The beds are hard, and the pillows too soft. The management have clearly not stayed a night in this hotel. If they had, they would realise the huge problems with it. Only stay if there isnt anything else....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HelenGomez
Reviews.Content: Yes this is an older property and so maybe is a little tired around the edges but some of the reviews do not do it justice. OK the rooms are on the small size but you are slap bang in the middle of the CBD district of Sydney and so space is at a premium and I think for the price the rooms were reasonable. The bed was comfortable and the linen clean, the bathroom was kept immaculate (some of the towels were a bit thread bare but that happens in any hotel) and functional. Desk was useful as we had to work as well - could do with some shelves for clothes rather than the wardrobe. The room was pretty quiet (we were on floor 8) - didn't hear the lift or the street/traffic outside which I was greatly and pleasantly surprised by. Occasionally heard the other room next to us but only the door closing and I think I was on a smoking floor but that is our fault for not requesting a non-smoking floor. Location is great - 2 minute walk to Monorail, 5 mins to Town Square station so you are perfectly placed to see all the sights and get around. Con- The internet was pretty expensive for a day AUD18. We didn't have breakfast there as there are plenty of food places close by that offer better value. Staff were helpful and friendly. We didn't really need to use them so don't have any other comments. We work in hospitality and I think this is a well run hotel. I would stay here again when staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “It's alright...”
Reviews.Author: KaiZ
Reviews.Content: The night we got there to check in we were referred to another hotel because of a broken pipe on one of the floor. We were sent over to The Menzies compliments of the hotel of course. What a bummer but then that issue was sorted out we ended up with a bed & a room for the first night instead of being homeless or should I say roomless with 2 huge suitcase. So we came back to the hotel the second day, was checked in without any issue. Room was pretty small but it's alright since we're just there for just a room & bed to come back to at night. Central location, close to restaurant, attractions (Circular Quay, The Rocks & Opera House) & Shopping (Pitt St Shopping) within walking distance. Overall I have to say this hotel is alright. Front desk staff is pretty good, they know their stuff and surrounding. There's a bar onsite, exercise room & a little cafe for breakfast. No free internet tho but then you could get free wifi from a nearby McDonalds. There's a supermarket across the street in World Square Mall and cheap food. Should check the pies out from Pie Face from across the street. Especially if you're not from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “A little grubby and tired round the edges, but comfortable and great value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good: excellent location, right next to World Square and Chinatown; very cheap for Sydney CBD; comfy beds, clean linen and towels, decent sized room with a desk; breakfast buffet cheap and plentiful, pretty quiet even with lots of nightlife right outside in the street Bad: a little scuffed and tired-looking; a blown light bulb in the room, lousy coffee

Reviews.Title: “ibis Syd”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay was all good not major complaints other then my iron board was broken it was a pleasent stay in a good locations nice and close to shops and alike and train stations......nothing more to say

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ï¼­ãƒŸã‚«ã‚¨ãƒ«
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights . It's good location. There is a lot of shops or Chinese Town near this hotel.You'll never feel inconvenient to shop. The standard guests' room is not too large ,but not narrow. It's kept cleanly and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: lembutikus
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, dark. The breakfast room is cramped, small and under staffed. The toilet is dirty. Moreover, the smell of the paint is strong. We had 2 miserable nights in this awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: jean d
Reviews.Content: I am a great fan of the Ibis hotels, having stayed in quite a few in Europe. On my first trip to Sydney in January 2010 I decided to stay in the Ibis World Center. It more than filled my expectations. Nice staff, clean room, with the usual Ibis amenities. The location was what made it great for me and my brother. Right in the heart of the active downtown, meaning that there was lots of activity at all hours. People to watch, talk to, have a drink with, etc. I was happy to pay for the long-term locker in the basement to store my large bag while I made a three day trip to Cairns. The hotel is within walking distance of the main rail station, and very close to subway and bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Air-conditional have serious issue”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The air-conditional in the hotel is terrible. The first night of staying they gave me a 2 single beds room because all queen bed rooms aircons are down. the 2 single beds room was not any better, the aircon was like a fan, no cooling function. Second day our aircon was down and we have to moved to another room which finally has a fully and proper working aircon. However, the room has serious cigerrate small, intolerable!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: imaholidayR
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11pm as organised. Turns out the Queen room on a non smoking floor that we booked and paid for a month earlier was 'not available'. As it was late and my husband and i had nowhere else to go, we agreed to stay in two single beds on a non smoking floor. I asked for our money back on that night because it was their mistake - they offered us free breakfast - not a fair trade. My 6ft 6 husband slept in a 5ft something bed in the worst room they had - no kidding - that's all they had leftover to give us. Filthy floors, grubby doors, paper thin walls, and mouldy shower base. The only clean thing in that room was the sheets. The next morning before leaving we confirmed with the reception that the room we paid for was going to be ready for us when we got back. She insisted it would be and that we should leave our luggage so they can place it in our new room, ready for our return. However we decided to lug or bags around the city until our return that night - and I'm glad we did. 10pm we returned to our hotel and, just as suspected, we were in fact STILL NOT BOOKED into a room (reminding you again that it was a month ago that we booked and paid for the room!). Luckily there was a room spare - queen on a nonsmoking floor complete with mouldy shower base and feisty tiles (we wore our thongs in the shower to avoid contracting anything). Obviously I wouldn't say much for that room either. They gave us no towels and took our soap. The next morning while leaving our room and saw a condom wrapper in the hall. The day after that it was still there. Shows how thorough the cleaners are. I could go on and on about our stay at the Ibis Pitt St Sydney but I think this should be enough to prove my disappointment in this hotel. I would never stay here again and HotelClub have lost all credibility for booking me into this hotel. Just dont even stay here. Walls are so thin you can hear the cleaner changing the bin liner next door. Pay and extra 30-50bucks/night and stay at nice hotel further down pitt st. The area of this hotel isn't very nice (dirty streets + next door to hotel is a 1 hour hotel - its not classy)

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi, A staff member entered my room in the middle of the night while i was watching t.v. simply said sorry thought this room was vacant then left and a $50 deposit was taken from my credit card on arrive but has not been returned yet. i have contacted reception but no response.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lu123442
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews on TA I was pleasantly surprised with our stay at Ibis. The hotel is in a great location opposite World Square Shopping Centre and only a 5-10 min walk to Chinatown and Paddy's Market. The monorail also stops outside the hotel. I booked a twin room with 2 single beds and was upgraded to a room with 2 king beds (which was basically two single beds pushed together), a bedside table, TV and built in wardrobe and desk. The room was an adequate size and the bathroom was quite large. The only downside to the bathroom is that there's no shower screen so the bathroom floor gets quite wet when you have a shower. Also the split system airconditioner was positioned above only one bed so I stayed cool however my friend found the room to be quite warm. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Ibis and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined My Trip”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: At first I was relieved when I arrived at this hotel after reading mixed reviews. I arrived at 10:30 am and they allowed me to check into my room right away. My room was small but pleasant..location was a little far, but definitely in walking distance from most of the tourist sites. My problems came the day I checked out. The hotel charges you .75 cents every time you use the phone in your room. It is not noted on the phone or anywhere near the phone for that matter. They also tried to charge me 57.00 for one call and 17.00 for another..claiming the calling card I was using must not have 'connected my call'. My bill was for 111.00. After looking over my account.. I realized they had not charged me once but twice for the amount on top of the 50.00 deposit that was pending from the day I checked in. When I called back to ask them why I was double charged they explained to me that they charged my card the day prior as a pending amount to ensure they would get their payment. There were two issues with this... isn't this why you take a deposit number one... and number two even after the 111.00 posted to my account, the initial pending amount they deducted is still missing from my account 5 days later. They informed me it would take 5 to 10 business days. I was traveling to Sydney from the US and was on a fixed budget for each day... I was left with limited amounts of money for the last two days of my journey and could not experience some of the things I had on the list because of this. It literally ruined my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most convenient hotels u can find right at the city!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is really convenient and the price is reasonable. it's also clean and quiet despite its location at the heart of the city. I'm very happy with my stay and will recommend to all my frens traveling there.

Reviews.Title: “unsatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Price was ridiculous for the room, the holes in the bathroom walls were not exactly hidden. The room was small for the price I paid. I could have stayed in a nicer cheaper hotel. email: gracie.gibbon91@hotmail.com ph: 0430067629

Reviews.Title: “sydney stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at this hotel. Staff were very helpfull and went out of their way to help us especially Ben. It is located in the lower part of Sydney with easy access to public transport and there are several restaurants and hotels very close by which have great a breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just a very basic room with average facilities in the room. Used a free voucher to stay there, would have been a bit upset if we had paid the $200ish asking price. Can definitely find better hotels for a better price.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind small spaces...”
Reviews.Author: onebell
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind small spaces because you plan to spend most of your time outside the hotel, this hotel would be good for you. As in many Ibis hotels, the location of this hotel is good for walking to many tourist areas, especially the Darling Harbour which is wonderful at night. Our hotel room is a bit small. The bathroom is also small. By small is meant not much space for our stuff. But the hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is basic, but you may decide to just have your breakfast outside. Next time I go back to Sydney, I'd try the Ibis Hotel on Darling Harbour, rather than this one on Pitt Street.

Reviews.Title: “Always great - we always return”
Reviews.Author: LindaFaz
Reviews.Content: This is just a gem of a hotel. Sure it's small (tiny even but so am I) It's just so centrally located to the best of all types of Asian restaurants and good pubs. The staff are always friendly, the room was spotless, sheets super clean and the towels fluffy - what more can you want? We were on 14th floor, if that helps anyone. Maybe we are just easy to please but we don't need lots and the price is right for CBD, no pesky taxi fares and close close close to the trains and shopping. They have a very secure locker system for leaving bags - about $8 and you can open and close it as much as you shop....

Reviews.Title: “Best frugal choice for central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: baydreams
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in #703 around end of October. Had more satisfactions and fewer complaints than other customers (luckily). I booked the room directly on website 2 months ahead, which offered promotional rate of average AU$134 per night. The hotel location is perfect for foreign visitors. Chinatown, Darling Harbor, major streets with their bus/rail stops, and free bus route are all within 5-15 min walking distance. The free bus (555) can take one to QVB shops, Circular Quay, and close enough to the Rocks, Opera House, Harbor Bridge and Botanical Garden. The World Square Mall is directly across the hotel, where daily shopping for food and meals can be done. Our room has a window that faces the closest street junction and some distant view of downtown. It is comfortably small and everything worked satisfactorily. We made fresh coffee from grounds we brought along, using the electric hot water jug in the room. It could be a bit innovative, by brewing the coffee in separate cups and waiting for the ground to settle down before consumption. It would be nice if a coffee maker or French press is provided. The mini-fridge was cold enough and quiet at sleeptime. The bathroom is brightly lit, with adequate shower stall. The toilet flush tank sometimes got stuck and cannot refill. But we learned quickly how to punch the button repeatly to make it work. The daily room cleanup was OK, except I noticed that the floor was not vacuumed daily. I did not complain since it is a minor thing and we habitually keep the room tidy. If there is a wish list, I would like to see more hanging tools around the room. We took the airport rail (AU$16 one way) to go downtown, and got off the Museum station in 15 min. Walking to the hotel for a few blocks took less than 10 min. But beware the Museum station has no elevator, only 2-3 flights of steps from the platform to street level. I decided not to take the shuttle bus (door to door, AU$14), since the commute time could be an hour or more, hence not practical for departure. The front desk staff was very helpful and courteous to everybody, to the extent that one may have to wait 5-10 min for their turn. After 6 days of visiting and having been familiar with Sydney, I would not pick another frugal hotel if we return in the future. This was our second time to stay in the Ibis hotel chain in slightly more than a year. The first time was in France. I am impressed with the quality, decor and pricing of this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 7 nights at Ibis World Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights there. Our comments are: Location: Fantastic - very convenient to meals and transport Parking: Poor - No parking at all. Even dropping off and picking up had to be done in a small "no parking" zone in a one-way street. Room size: very small Cleanliness: Good Routine servaice: good Auxiliary service: poor: The air cond was not cool enough. The TV remote did not work. The assistants came several times only to push a button at the back of the TV to turn it on, ignoring my plea that the batteries in the remote should be replaced. Finally the batteries were replaced on our last day of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our nite in the city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Shower had mould in it - felt dirty - didnt enjoy having a shower Breakfast was average - not much selection - poor quality cooking - pouched eggs ordinary - fruit looked old Front desk was helpful - late nite snacks appeared ordinary on the menu Location was good / parking was ok

Reviews.Title: “Your hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: bdg007 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs paint, carpet clean and a good wash. Also rooms are generally on the side of cramped. Price has seems to have doubled in six years for a hotel that is looking pretty tired with small rooms. Also manager tried to enter our room after we were in bed...not sure what that was all about.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff! Bad ammenities! Misrepresented airport services!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The ONLY reason that i booked this particular hotel was because they listed "Airport shuttle" as one of their services. Sadly, there was NO airport shuttle. had to pay $40 to get there from the airport. The young lady at the front desk politely offered to call me a van or a taxi. Van = $15 Taxi = $40. So the extra $80 in cabs, could have been spent on a hotel that doesn't charge by the hour for guest computers and doesn't have rooms that smell like wet ashtrays. I really could have spent that $80 staying somewhere where you feel like a guest and not a nuisance. Staff was friendly and tried to be helpful with what they have but you could tell that they are slightly embarassed by having to apologize all day long for a living, I am not a high maintenance customer and rarely complain even when dealing with lowered expectations. Honestly, I can deal with cold, scuminess and even misbookings! But this was pretty bad. PLEASE REMOVE AIRPORT SHUTTLE SERVICE FROM LIST OF AMMENITIES! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with our stay - black hair covered the bathroom, stains on the bathroom ceiling, shower not clean, damage to the suitcase stand - worst of all moved bedside table out slightly to plug in mobile charger to be met with filth and to see that they had not bothered to paint the wall behind the bedside tables or the bed. Only good thing was the proximity to the CBD but apart from that would not recommend this hotel, unless money was spent to bring it up to scratch!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday gone wrong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nothing in the room worked properly, fridge door was off it's hinge, air conditioning didn't work on 2 out of 3 days, clock didn't work, TV was off tune and hummed the whole time. Staff tried to be helpful but the facilities were poor

Reviews.Title: “Connvenient stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Main reason for this stay was location of hotel to CBD. We were going to Westfield to dine and then to State theatre, so location was within walking distance. Rooms a bit dated and very minimal, but clean. Housekeeping need to lift game a bit, only one coffee satchet for 2 guests! and absolutely no sugar for us to use - not everybody will use Equal (2 satchets), so a bit more care in making sure supplies are replenished would be appreciated, I know you only have to ring reception, but you shouldn't have to!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Leanne C
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms, both for 7 nights. The air-conditioning did not work in either rooms initially, but the staff were very helpful and moved us the next day. They even gave us fans for the first night and gave us a free breakfast for the first morning to apologies. The rooms are small, but have everything you need, and are always clean. The beds are very comfortable, and bathrooms were great. All of the staff, no matter what time it was, were so friendly and helpfull. The breakfast was nice, and they even had popcorn available when you passed through reception to the lifts!! Lastly....The location of this hotel is fantastic, 5 mins walk to Chinatown, and only 7-10mins walk to Darling Harbour. We had a great stay and would highly reccommend this hotel! Â

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room but hotel in desprate need of an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: kerrie c
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room - staying in disability room due to my disability. Air conditioner noisey & old. Wheelchair lift to breakfast dining wasn't working til mid week unsatisfactory. Strongly suggest fully accessable / licanced restaurant in new renovations so a person like myself isn't strolling all over town @ night in search for something to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Good posotion.”
Reviews.Author: aulynch Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to central station and easy walking to other areas too. The rooms are clean and comfortable. My only megative is that it is really in need of a paint job. The walls and doors are well scuffed. Breakfast is good,pretty simple, but sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Ibis in the city; it was in walking distance to everything we needed and wanted! it was so close to darling harbour, the rocks and sydney harbour as well as the train station to go to the blue mountains for a day trip. the hotel itself was clean and staff were friendly but busy. beds were comfortable. loved that our room had a fridge :) there is a smoker level, we were put on the level above and as i was pregnant i asked to be moved to another level; staff were easy to approach, friendly and moved us with no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very strategic location in CBD but the bar and counter services are so so only. Check in was quick but no early check in is allowed. The staffs very friendly but the hotel does not has much option in food...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: clonmel12
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I booked a twin room for 4 days on a business trip. My daughter has stayed before and nothing has changed. The Service was always friendly, prompt, and precise. The first room we were given had air conditioning problems but after a call to reception we were quickly moved to an identical room on another floor. This room was small as are all Ibis rooms but adequate as we would not be spending much time in the hotel. All the usual facilities are available and the room was clean and the beds comfortable. The Ipod Dock was also a nice touch and often used. The bathrooms are small but adequate and my only complaint was that a smell did emanate from the shower when not in use but this was not noticed in the room and once used the smell disappeared. The Linen and towels were spotless and at the end of the day it was nice to come back and relax. We were on floor 11 and there was no noise from outside unlike some of the nearby upmarket hotels that I have stayed in. I did not have breakfast but my daughter said that the full buffet breakfast was very good offering both hot and cold food. When making the reservation do not book breakfast as it is usually offered at reception for just over half the online price just simply ask for a breakfast voucher during the day. The location is ideal for those using public transport and there are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby to tempt any visitor. If you want a no fuss, cheap stay without the trimmings then I recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why offer a room that has no aircon.. Not happy!”
Reviews.Author: Alma T
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to attend a conference in Sydney and was booked to stay at this hotel. At first I thought its good for a night stay but then I noticed that there was no aircon in the room. I rang the Reception and I was told that the aircon is controlled from downstairs so it cannot be operated manually. The receptionist apologised for not turning this on before I got into the room and was asked to wait for 15 minutes. The time past but I am not getting any air, given the Sydney's temperature was on 34 degree celsius. So I rang again and was told that they are upgrading their aircon and was told to check two other rooms. But the two rooms that I was shown are even hotter. This was 11:30pm by the way and the lady cannot provide any other room for me but settled on provide a portable electric fan for the night and even offered for a free breakfast, but she knew I already prepaid for it. In other words, I did not sleep at all with the fan emitting hot air as well. I don't know why they offer their rooms when the amenities are missing. This is totally misleading... be warned...

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check out service was poor, with long waits for quite a few people and muddling up of details when checking out. Staff seemed to be inconvenienced by the fact that there were people that required assistance. Otherwise a decent stay. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “If there is NO where else left to stay”
Reviews.Author: Waikatosflyingkiwi
Reviews.Content: Came to Sydney for nephews wedding, this hotel was close to ativities connected with this celebration. As a loyalty program member I would expect a little better. Had booked and paid for a twin room for my daughter and myself. I rang the hotel to make sure of the configuration and was assured that we would get a twin. Given a triple beded room. The extra bed making the already small box smaller. The view from the window is a cement wall and no matter how hard you try to see sky you cant. This window does not open therefore if you wish to breath you must have the air com on. Other guests also complaining about this. The batroom design satisfactory but extractor fan usless leaving you sweating. Hand basin water bubbled up from drain in centre of floor. Good flat screen television. Light fittings cheap and wobbled at touch. Staff helpful. Room cleaned well each day and bed linen changed after two nights. As mentioned had paid prior to our arrival but on departure told in front of other guests that the account department have said we had not. Have recieved email from management saying they would do better in the future and try to rectify problems. I have just checked my credit card account and they have CHARGE us again! Just not good enough. Costing fees for card/off shore service margins/conversion rate. Stay here again? I do not think so.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value situated almost in the middle of the Sydney CBD. It is close to everything including shops, bars, restaurants and businesses. Staff are friendly and rooms are clean, quiet and more than adequate. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. The service provided by the staff on the front desk is second to none. However, the bathroom was not as clean as I would have liked (long black hairs on the floor ... not mine) and it remained that way even after my room was cleaned each day. I left a sign on my door indicating that I did not wish to have my room serviced, but the cleaners ignored this each day. The air conditioner was noisy and vibrating with one side panel dislodged. Each morning I was woken up, very early, to the sound of a drill in an adjoining room. Just for your information ... Although the bathroom appeared to be designed to allow disabled access, the fact that there were two king sized beds in the room would make it impossible for anyone in a wheelchair to move around. Despite these issues raised, I enjoyed my stay and felt it got reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “restaurant / reception service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Restaurant service poor, bread, juice, milk left to run out and only re-stocked when bought to attending staff attention. Staff attending departure next day either not understanding or not listening when patron giving information about bill. Inprint of visa taken on arrival, not cancelled on departure, dinning room charged to room and was paid with cash on departure, cretit card debited $100 when I made phone enquiry I was told that credit would not be reimbursed for 5 working days. NOT GOOD ENOUGH.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis "Word Square"”
Reviews.Author: paulsut Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Naming the hotel as Ibis World Square is a misleading advertising. We would imagine since it said "World Square" that the hotel would be located inside the complex. It was a shock to find the hotel across the World Square complex and it was a total shock to find a very small building accommodating the hotel. If we had known such a fact, we would have chosen to stay at Ibis Darling Harbour instead (for a much cheaper price as well). The AC didn't work when we checked in. The room is old.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Wing I
Reviews.Content: Close to everything. Small room but nice and clean. Comfortable bed though the only chair in the room needs upgrade. Helpful staff and reasonable price too. Just hope the internet can be faster since $8 per hour with less than dial-up speed at peak hours isn't very good value for money. Couldn't even get my email load sometimes so plenty of time wasted on waiting for things to load. I strongly suggest another option of $10-12 for a 3-4 hours session besides the existing 3 options, would be nice if this can be improved on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: PViews Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel quite a few times over the past year. Front desk service was excellent, which is always a good start for any trip. Rooms are clean and quiet, and close to chinatown for a good feed.

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband my 2 years old little girl and myself stayed to your hotel on the 08/10/2011 â€“ 10/10/2011. This stay was not a pleasant stay due to a number of reasons. First the shower floor was not clean and it had mould in the shower. Second the customer service that we received was not the best on the Monday of checking out we had the buffet breakfast I am pregnant and I could not eat the eggs because they where runny. I saw a sign that said that if we wanted different eggs to ask your friendly staff and they will make you different eggs, when I asked the chef said no. So much for your sign if you are not going to make different eggs donâ€™t have the sign up. Third as we were checking out of your hotel the lady that was serving us was not helpful at all she gave me a ticket so that I could get my car from the Word Square car park she said that all I need to do is to put my parking ticket in first then the ticket that she gave me in second. I did what she said and I had to pay $90.78 (but on check in she said that the parking was not going to be more than $35.00) When I got back from getting my car my husband said that I need to pay another $35.00 for parking at the hotel I told the lady that I have already payed $90.78 for parking and she said that she could not help me and that I still need to pay the $35.00 and if I want to try and get my money back I need to talk to the Work Square car park. So now I am out of pocket $90.78 and she was not willing to even help me get the money back after all it was her fault for not giving me enough tickets to clear my parking. I went to go and speak to the lady at the Word Square car park she said that she has issues with your staff all the time with this issue and that I will need to talk to the head office regarding this issue but she also said that I will most likely not get my money back from them either, so now I am trying to get my money back from the Word Square car park. If I cannot get my money back I think your hotel should pay me back after all it was your fault to start off with. So all in all staying at your hotel was a rip off and the worst customer service that I have ever received. I have already told friends and family members of this experience and they will not be staying with the Ibis hotels again either.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment! Room and floor hot as an oven!”
Reviews.Author: BHG2011
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience to the Accor hotel family, unfortunately the Ibis did not make a good first impression we would not choose to stay in this brand again and this experience would deter us in staying even in the more upscale brands in the Accor group. We chose the hotel because of the location- we were not disappointed with regards to this aspect. However the room we were allocated was a disappointment, it was small, claustrophobic but the worst thing was the air conditioning - old, dirty and it did not work. The temperature panel said 16 degrees but it felt more like 28 degrees! Since we were travelling with our baby needless to say we decided to leave after dinner. In short to give a balance review on the plus side: location (can't beat it especially for food, and chinatown night markets), the room was reasonably clean, reception service average although on check in the staff forgot to return my drivers licence. The room size would not have mattered as much (I have stayed in similar size rooms in Europe and Japan) if the air con was clean and working.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: daw01
Reviews.Content: Hotel is showing its age but still quite clean and tidy. It is well located in the centre of Sydney and aesy walking distance to trains etc. Many good resturants close by also. I would recommend staying here if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Very central. close to train station, theatre and short walk to opera house. walls and fittings getting a bit tired, as is the bathroom. very comfortable bed. oooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo

Reviews.Title: “sleepless”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had 3 different rooms booked. i myself was in a room of four single beds on a friday night and super disappointed in the ongoing constant noise (this went on until at least 5am) in the morning coming from the pub next door. We did not sleep a wink. We let the staff of the hotel know this and were told we could have our breakfast on the house.....which was no good to me as i had to leave at 7am. We were sooooooooo disappointred that we could not relax and sleep as we expected from your hotel. Very disappointed - i feel sorry for future guests who book at your hotel - who encounter this problem. People should be able to sleep without disruptions such as this - especially when we paid good money for our rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in town and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: wombatdavid
Reviews.Content: The check in was fast and friendly; the hotel is located near Chinatown near buses on George Street, Museum Train station (for airportlink) and monorail. The room was an unusual shape, but good because it meant that the door was a long way from the bed. The room had two windows and a view over George Street. There was a fridge, kettle and flat screen TV (but no digital channels). The bathroom only had a shower, but was fine for a short stay. Only issues were a very dirty air conditioner which blew out dust everywhere & seemed to be half broken and a flickering bulb - they need to keep up with their maintenance... Overall a great value stay ($111 on accor website); like the free newspapers and magazines in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, good position”
Reviews.Author: ShepLapstone
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the Ibis World Sqaure and found it excellent value at the very low price I paid after booking well in advance. Smallish room, but with very good clean bathroom, comfortable bed and plenty of desk space. It looked like new soft carpet on the floor in my room. Very close to Darling Harbour and city centre. Only thing that was no so good was the absolutely filthy dirty (exterior) of the only window in my room. Note there is $7 fee to store luggage. Also there is a fee to pay with a credit card on checkout if the cost of the room is not prepaid on a website when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Sporthead
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay here as part of a bucks party in the city. We had booked 3 of the bigger rooms in the hotel, each large enough to accommodate 2 king size beds comfortably. The amenities were basic, but we just wanted a bed to crash at the end of the night and weren't after pampering at the hotel. Hotel itself is very centrally located in the CBD, parking is off site across the road at World Square. You get a discount as a hotel guest but $35 I found to be quite steep. In most 5 star establishments you might pay a couple dollars more for vallet parking and you don't have to catch 2 lifts, an escalator, climb a set of stairs and cross the road to get from you car to the hotel lobby! Other than that I can't fault the hotel. The staff were enthusiastic and friendly enough. We knew we weren't staying in the Shangri-La (by the way read my separate review for the Shangri-La), so we weren't expecting anything other than budget accommodation. The size of the room we were staying in could comfortably sleep a family or even 4 adults, so I would recommend this for families or groups on short term stays or on a budget holiday. There are literally hundreds of dining and entertainment options at the door! If you're used to getting pampered and the finer things in life then this place is probably not for you (though in Sydney, you could definitely do worse). Overall, its a great value for money if you're just after a bed after a big night out on the town!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: charlieNewZealand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Ibis and found it to be clean and comfortable and very handy to the Central train station and monorail stop. Our room was small but had everything we needed and was quiet. The efficient staff checked us in early which was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Long Lunch & Sleep Over”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just what we required not over the top but very comfortable & Clean. Can you believe check in at 9.20am. Now that's impressive! Heaps of food outlets at your door steps. The Hotels second floor restaurant was getting a huge make over the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and quality budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: PidynTeithio
Reviews.Content: Right across the road from world square and only a short walk to Pitt St Mall, this hotel with it's pleasant staff and good rates hit the mark for me. Their late hours snacks turned out to be quite substantial and with a small selection of beers this was an excellent convenience when we arrived late in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap doesn't always come at the cost of good service”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTravelerHK Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good experiences and cheap hotels are not always mutually exclusive. After a long flight and arriving too early in the morning for anyone's good and with my first meeting only an hour away the very friendly staff at front desk were more than accommodating in finding a clean, vacant room for me to check into 5-hours before check-in time, so that I could shower and freshen up for meetings. [Keep in mind I paid less than half the normal price for the most basic room due to an Accor sale.] The rooms are some of the smallest and barest I have ever stayed in (hence the low price) but when you're dealing with friendly, caring staff none of that seems to matter. Breakfast, which is available at a steep discount if you pre-pay, was simple in a do-it-yourself kind of way and the reminder that even a business man is able to toast their own bread is refreshing and appropriate for the location! It was nice watching families and small groups debate their day ahead, seeking input from dining room staff on buses, museums and everything in between - in many ways this property felt quite homely. Not to harp on about the quality of the rooms but they are literally 4 simple walls with a sturdy-but-old bed with slimline TV high on the wall opposite and a small window in which to judge the outside weather. The bathrooms are tiny and offer only the barest of amenities and the air-con at least 10 years old. However, the taps did not drip, the air-con did not groan and the doors kept all outside noise there, and mine in. When you add it all up this property is not a bad stay - albeit for a short trip where the main goal was being able to get some sleep in between meetings! Kudos to the great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but secure and comfortable, right amongst the action.”
Reviews.Author: coffee_bean85
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin bed room with a friend for 2 nights over a weekend. The hotel is opposite the World Square building, a short walk to train stations, chinatown and surrounded by nightspots! Compared to other Aussie Ibis hotels this one has an older feel - worn carpet, hallway furnishings and marked doors etc. Rooms have all the basics - tea coffee room service menu etc but are small and limited. Definitely a hotel for people who plan to be out and about and just want a central and private place to sleep. Lovely staff, my tv didn't work at first and the maintenave guys came up within 5 minutes. The front reception door is secured at night - u need ur swipe card to get in and considering there is a noisy pub right next door this is a good thing! I paid $331 for the 2 nights - and wouldn't pay more than that. Would stay here again only if I was doing a similar trip - seeing a band, out all day/night catching up with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: JuniAuckland
Reviews.Content: Easy access from airport via Airport Line and Musuem Station. Located at top of main streets and beside shopping mall. Free magazines in lobby plus bar and snacks. Appreciated not being hassled by housekeeping when wanting a sleep-in in the morning. Would stay here on next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “I don't want to wake up all night!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Niosy room!! All other guest say you can hear. The luggage , the door , the phone call ... If you want to know other business, you should stay here. Air condition did not work all night . Don't know why. By the way I am hard-to-sleep people. But the location is OK ,easy to go everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney 3 1/3 Star”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While I was not expecting top of the line facilitities as it was a 3 1/2 star hotel, I must say that even at that level this hotel was exceptionally poor.
