Service was fine and staff freidnly but the room had a un clean feel to it and shower was slimy. The room was also very small and not at all suitable for two people. Walls are paper thin and you could hear everything that was going on in the room next door. Not my best experience. Location though is great!

Reviews.Title: “Tap Dancer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located in lively neighbourhood predominantly Korean/Chinese. Friday/Saturday night crowds outside queuing to go to disco club next door as a result the automatic doors are locked so need to attract receptionist to let you in. The disco/club itself cannot be heard. Dinning room attendant creates a huge amount of noise walking across the wooden floor boards in shoes with metal heel caps. Unfortunately, he doesn't know how to tap dance. Having lots of people around late at night makes if feel safe. Convenient location and value for money. Good shower.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: FlyerAuckland
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were on a shopping trip and stayed for four nights at Ibis. Full marks to the front desk staff who never fail to give you a smile and are always very helpful. Arrived 4 hours early but we were checked in straight away as the room was available,thanks!! Rooms were small but we expected this having read other reviews before we booked so weren't particularly disappointed.Cleaning ok but last 2 days, soaps were not replaced and instead of nice fluffy towels were given some worn out towels on our last nite.( not really a big deal but it would be nice to be consistent)Full breakfast buffet available for $20 which we tried and was average but there are plenty of cafes and places to dine located around the area eg. World Square Location great! walking distance or monorail to city centre, darling harbour,chinatown.paddys market etc.. Lockers available for storage at $7 for 24 hrs which was convenient as we had a late departing flight

Reviews.Title: “OK for a decent night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: Don't expect anything fancy at the IBIS World Square (and don't expect it to have anything to do with the World Square development, either!), but it provides a decent night's sleep for a reasonable price. Rooms (and particularly bathrooms) are small, but the are reasonably furnished and sleep quality was good. The room had coffee and tea making facilities, an iron and ironing board and a small desk for your laptop. Selection of cable TV channels was basic but enough. Service from the staff was excellent. A (very) early check in was no problem, and a small issue I had with the internet was dealt with promptly and with a smile. Location is a little on the seedy side, but it's only a short walk to everywhere you need to be. The lobby seems to be constantly crowded with small-group package tourists from Asia. As far as I can tell, they spend their entire time in Sydney sitting in the lobby of the Ibis arguing with their guides, but each to their own! Price is reasonable (by Sydney standards), though internet is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Short Sydney stopover to catch a show.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stayover in Sydney apart from the weather!! Rained cats and dogs solidly for two days. Hotel was great location for the theatre that we had tickets for. Staff were exceptionally helpful supplying us with towes in reception when we arrived drenched after having to run from the train station. Had managed to get the nights on an extra good special so overall very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney as a tourist”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very basic hotel rooms but good value for the price. Decor and facilities are aged but serviceable. Good location within comfortable walking distance of main tourist destinations or gateways to.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent..the girl at the front desk was lovely, helpful and friendly. My only complaint is about...THE PILLOW! It was the most horrible piece of pillow i ve ever slept with..SWEAR TO GOD..no kidding!

Reviews.Title: “Traveller”
Reviews.Author: AussieExplorerSale Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice staff.quiet room only down side was parking, having to carry luggage through the rain to get to parking garage on other side of the street . Would stay again if i had yo stay in that part of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Content: It's located in a seedy part of Sydney with adult entertainment places everywhere around. Sydney is a very easy city to navigate, even on foot. Everything is usually very close, and most tourist attractions are in walkable distance from anywhere! But this place just was not pleasant to come back to at night. Internet access is overpriced; you have an option of buying the Internet time in 1 minute increments, but if you do buy a minute or two, before you are connected, your time is already up. A small fridge is a plus. Very little storing space in the room and bathroom - even for your toothbrushes is a minus. You must pay separately for safe ($7 a day) if you want to use one. The alarm clock in the room did not work. The television screen did not show the entire image (not just in our room, but everywhere, including the reception area). Breakfast was highly overpriced. The room looked relatively clean, but every day there was somebody's hair (not ours) sticking to our freshly changed towels... Having some dishes, like cups, saucers and the silverware would be a nice touch, but they were not washed adequately. The beds were big and nice, but the pillows were awful! The design of the bathroom without a wall or a tub or any barrier between the shower and the rest of the bathroom except for a flimsy shower curtain that ends a foot above the floor ensures that the entire bathroom floor is always wet. The staff at the front desk was indifferent and impersonal, not particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Leeduf
Reviews.Content: a great little hotel in the heart of Sydney CBD...close to everything you want...Food..Shopping..Theatre!!..Not a 5 star hotel,but the staff are friendly,the rooms are clean..( a bit on the small side,but hey,you aren't going to be spending hours in your room are you,what with all that shopping to do???) I stay here every chance i get !!..Transport is great...A choice of light rail and monorail,plenty of taxis to get you to where you want to go.A hop ,skip and a jump to "The Rocks" and many other iconic Aussie tourist spots!!....a must stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very small and claustrophobic, although good location. Bathroom very small, towels very thin and tatty, bit grotty overall. But bed was clean and comfy which is the main thing after all. Location close to monorail. We just needed a stopover for one night so was sufficient for our purposes and budget.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: low noise, good location great price, excellent service. Located close to central shopping centres the monorail station and major local attractions. Clean and tidy and reasonably priced and easy walk to all things to do!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location. location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not large, but clean and well presented. Great value - location, location. location - CBD 50m from the monorail and 150m from underground. Generous, affordable, full buffet breakfast. Friendly, helpfull staff. Maloney's Pub opposite serves good meals until 10pm starting at $9.95 weeknights - terriffic value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location for city and theatres, monorail and central station. No hairdryers in rooms, breakfast had fairly good variety, but a better muesli could have been added. Mix up/overcharge for breakfast on our bill, but was sorted out. Hotel offers $7 for basement storage of luggage but after asking advised another area with no charge was offered.(This was with no responsibility for loss).

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square - a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and continues to be great value for money. Convenient - slightly out of the main shopping area but easy walking distance to everything including public transport. Always neat and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location , easy to go to anywhere. Only five minute to go to the monorail. It locate on the Pitt street next to the china town and 10 minute walk to Westfield and David jones. if u know your friend who wanna go to Sydney , pls recommend this hotel. It very great value.

Reviews.Title: “concerns”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast not really up to standard expected. Cereal containers marked oncorrect, yoghurt not palatable, eggs, sloppy. No directions to access car parking. Reception staff very friendly especially George.

Reviews.Title: “very accommodating for an unwell guest”
Reviews.Author: rroger_rramjet
Reviews.Content: Besides struggling to find the place I would highly recommend the Ibis World Square. I arrived in Sydney early in the morning and by mid morning was feeling the effects of flu. The fantastic staff at the Ibis were more than accommodating with a very early check in at no cost. I was also told they could arrange medical services if I needed them. Just what you need when you are away from home and feeling ill. Whilst the rooms are cabin like (very small) they were more than comfortable. They were incredibly quiet considering their location. The beds were firm with good quality and clean linen and the showers hot and powerful. The room was also spotless. For the cost I could not fault them. In fact the service and cleanliness put some of Sydney's more expensive establishments to shame. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The sheets on the bed had holes in them and they appeared not all that clean. That may have been due to the age. The airconditioning was old and damage both the controls and the unit. The door security latch was half missing. Other wise it was ok for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location and friendly staff was a positive. Availability of a food ordering service 24 hrs was also a plus. On the negative, walls are thin and easy to hear a lot that is happening outside your room. The internet credit only offers a single log on even though the time its valid for has not lapsed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very effecient and friendly front line receptionists - location was fantastic to access the downtown and Chinatown parts of the city. Sometimes, it appeared that the walls were very thin but I was able to have a great nights' sleep in a very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: food was bad rooms were bad, hard pillows, very litlle varity for breakfast and no lunch or dinner in the resturant, grabbit/takeaway menu is 5 curries and that its. very thin walls between rooms so i hope u don't won't sleep as u can hear everything essipacly on a friday and satyrday night because there are three pubs/nightclubs right next to the ibis at world square. have to pay to store lugage when 90 percent of other accor hotel do that for free. i had to pay 7 dollars for 2 hours which sucks cause you don't get it back. staff not very friendly. housekeeping don't follow there own rules you know that little card that say leave on the bed and hag ur towels back up, did that every day and i still got fresh towels and sheets everyday it got quite anoying

Reviews.Title: “Strategic Home Base”
Reviews.Author: loki_niflheim Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff, if understaffed. Check-in was fast, but check-out took 20 minutes wait. The room was booked for two, but were missing a towel. A call to the front desk was met with a puzzled, "what do you want?" after we explained we're missing a towel. Room is clean, with a burn mark on the carpet. Recommended for great home base to explore Sydney city with the basic hotel accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We went into Sydney to catch up with my son and to enjoy a night in the city. We found the Ibis to be in the right location we were welcomed warmly and enjoyed a very pleasant stay . I will definitely stay at the Ibis again.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, rooms basic with small bathroom. Noise from hall and adjacent rooms quiet loud. Good pricing for location but look out for specials from others as monorail is very convienient for travell arounf the city. Plenty of food outlets and restaurants nearby so lack of restaurant at the hotel is not unworkable. AIr conditioners / heaters seem to work intermitently.

Reviews.Title: “In time of need”
Reviews.Author: 6STRINGS Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: all in all the hotel has friendly staff who want to help. They came through for me when all other hotels where booked, they gave me a room at the last hour which I appreciated. Location is good if you like to be close to Chinatown with many good value Asian restaurants around, and with the monorail nearby means you can get around the city easily. It's an Ibis standard but the rooms are clean, comfortable and come with plasma TV.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty happy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall we were very happy with the service and price. Staff are friendly and helpful. Unfortunately we were keen to watch a movie once our little guy went to sleep however the in-house movies didn't work. Rooms a little tight

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Sydney World Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean however front desk service didn't come with a smile. We were also given a room on a low floor just above a nightclub so it was terribly noisy all night. I was also unable to find a powerpoint near the bed so had to leave my phone in the bathroom to charge. Parking is a hassle especially if you have a lot of luggage as they use the World Square carpark across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but they're par for the course in a city, and they were clean and tidy and included nice things like an iron, electric kettle, and refrigerator. Location was superb, especially if your food taste tends towards Chinese, Korean, and Thai, as mine does. George the night reception guy was superbly friendly and helpful, and he even arranged a free bottle of wine for us as we were passing through on our honeymoon. Would definitely stay again if I'm in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feeling about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wally888 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was staying at a room on the 3rd floor on both Friday and Saturday nights. I think there's a dance club of some sort at the Civic Hotel, the building right next, they were all partying like crazy. I can hear clearly what music they are playing, and they yelling of those partygoers. Couldn't really sleep until 4AM when their party was over. However, this wasn't happen for the nights from Sunday to Tuesday. However, the location is terrific. So I recommend people to get rooms that are located above the 10th floor or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staff, room and breakfast. Great location. For a solo traveler, room was a nice size, great LCD TV. Located in the heart of the CBD which made it easy to get to all my appointments. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: broadhorizons01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis World Square for it's close proximity to the Capitol Theatre. The World Square area in Sydney is not my favourite location. For international tourists, it's not where you would want to be. If you stay on a Saturday night, ask for a high floor room, as live bands playing at the pub across the road was very loud, until 4.30am! Short walk to Darling Harbour. No great restaurants nearby, only Asian. Close to the monorail for a quick trip down to Pitt Street Mall, or an easy 4 block walk. The hotel itself was OK. Room clean, but small. Bathrooms small and older style. To be expected from a Ibis. In-house movie $17 each! Service OK. Some miscommunication from front desk staff led us to pay more for the parking across the road than we should have. Breakfast special at $12.50pp was cheap and quality was pretty good. No room service. Bar snacks available. If I need to stay near the Capitol Theatre again, I'll try the Rydges in a high floor room.

Reviews.Title: “good for overnite”
Reviews.Author: alnezer17
Reviews.Content: flew over from nz and stayed here overnite so we could catch our international flight in the morn. On the accorhotels.com website it stated that they had airport transfers but it came at a cost. I mistakingly thought that it was free. The lock in our room was broken so we had no security, room was small for my liking but the beds were the most comfortable ive ever slept on. Great location, numerous bars down the road and a supermarket across the st.

Reviews.Title: “Good loacation for Chinatown and World Square”
Reviews.Author: shirlz99 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you want to be near China Town and the backpacker end of George St. Across the road from World Square shops, parking is inside the world square. Hotel room is fine, no 5star but it was clean and accomodated for what we needed, which was to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & convenient”
Reviews.Author: allanne
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel adequate to our needs & were very pleased to be able to use the Plus $1 for parking. Our 1st floor room faced Pitt St but we found it very quiet. As one of us is in a wheelchair we requested an accessible room. This was fine except there were 2 King Beds in the tiny space which would be fine for able bodied people looking for a twin room, although we only needed a double. The space taken by the 2nd bed meant that it was impossible to get the wheelchair anywhere near the desk / tea & coffee making facilities/cupboard as the easy chairs which should have been in that space were jammed at the end of the bed blocking any possible way past. On request we were provided with a shower chair. We would have appreciated f a hand/face towel in the bathroom, & there were only 4 tabags, 2 sugars plus about 15 pkts of Equal (which we don't use). Reception were very friendly & helpful but obviously understaffed during our check-in & check-out times (go figure) leading to queues of people, luggage (&wheelchair) in another small space.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My room is very clean. The heater was broken when I stayed there. Luckily, it was not yet winter. I do hope the maintenance staff will check on that. It's very cheap considering that it is located in the World Square Tower. The only bad thing about this hotel is the manager at the reception was so impolite and it seems to me that she's a little bit racist.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good rooom and service. The only let down was very poor TV rtecetion. The picture was grainy and it seemed the TV was not tuned very well. The TV was tuned to the analogue signal and should be upgraded to the newer digital signals.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square”
Reviews.Author: ResidentPom Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Budget business hotel and rooms match this category. Enough space for a short stay witha work space but little storage. Air con controller broken and not working properly - only cool not heat. No sugar only sweetener so rom not serviced properly. Otherwise Ok Central location so some road noise

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For a hotel in the middle of Sydney it is very reasonably priced and found it very good for business accomodation which is what we used it for. The beds were a little hard and the room was pretty small for what was in it. Probably not recommended as a hotel to stay in with a family. in saying that they have other rooms which would be more suited for families but as the review is based on what we experienced i have noted this.

Reviews.Title: “Chilly”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Couldn't get them to turn on the heater in the room depsite numerous requests so the room was pretty cold. The room was tiny, the bed was hard and the pillows were lumpy. The breakfast was dreadful - a complete waste of money. The location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoSixFiveOh Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been reviewed by many others - so here's one paragraph confirming: basic hotel, basic room, minimal with frills, clean, good value and very central. Easy to get cab/van transport to airport. Plenty of food and shopping all round. Tested the front counter for travelling info and they gave it correctly. However, one warning - they can be very busy (usually one person in attendance, two persons at peak hours - I even got a pic for you -- be prepared to wait when you need to approach the front office). The air conditioning/heating is a bit quirky to operate but a bit of patience will get you the temperature you want. Now here's the few pointers that others would appreciate - There's a laundry machine and dryer (coins required) in the basement. There is *no* concierge of left luggage service. Instead you put them in lockers - yes, you pay for them (see pictures), there's even a medicine and amenities dispenser. Those travelling with awkward cables that come out at the bottom of the Australian plug - bring a power board. This mistake is so obvious (see picture). I had a $1 deal for breakfast or Internet and I took Internet. It was a wired service. There is no wireless Internet. Note to hotel: My chair had some nasty dried white stains on them. I won't attempt to guess what it was!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The accommodation really met our needs. We were right in the city, the room was comfortable and clean, we only required somewhere to sleep we didn't spend much time in the room during the day. Tea and coffee provided, Staff on front desk really friendly and helpful. Would recommend this if you are happy with a tad less than 5 star accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: LindaDarwinAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on a 'shopping/see a show' weekend. Our room was just great for our needs as we weren't spending all day in the room. We needed functionality for a good price and that is what we got. Clean, enough room for two to move around and close to shopping, Chinatown and the train. The staff were friendly, efficient and good with local knowledge. The rooms aren't huge but would suit a business traveller well as there is a small desk and wardrobe space enough to hang a few clothes. Usual ironing equipment, tea and coffee, fridge, hairdryer etc. We were on 13th floor so no traffic noise or lights to bother us. All in all, a functional and efficient hotel. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: glasskate
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in walking distance of many restaurants and shops our room was very small, would be ok for 1 person, for 2 people too little room to get comfortable

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally situated. We could walk to all the sights which gave us lots to look at on the way to the Botanical Gardens, the Opera House and Circular quay. Here are many eating places and sitting under aan umbrella in the sun watching the ferries come and go. From here it is a short walk to the Bridge and the Rocks where Sydney's History unfolds. Old buildings and cobble streets, We were lucky because it was Sunday and so a walk through the streetmarket was pleasant. A visit to Darling harbour is a must especially at night when all the lights reflect in the bay. Here there are so many entertainments and again so many places to eat be it cheap or expensive. Going into the CBD proper is also very interesting, seeing old buildings the Town Hall, Queen Victoria building in George street is a treat with all the beautiful shops inside The architecture and stainglass exceptional as is St. Andrews Cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: indi_pendent
Reviews.Content: This was my staple hotel before I started staying in the darling harbor novotel or Ibis. Pretty good location with a metro station bang opposite. Good eateries around and the place is always bustling. The rooms are decent and the balconies are a great help. Service is ok. The beds were a bit soft and they did change them once I asked them to do so. The room service menu is pretty limited.

Reviews.Title: “Really average”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Whilst in a stellar location the room was pokey, as was the shower.Having to stand still and not move for fear of hitting the tap or soap dish and I am only a skinny guy. Funniest part was the tiny broken ironing board that was too tall to stand on the bench and use but too low to stand on the ground. Thus I chose to sit down on the truck stop cafe style chair and conduct my ironing. The ironing board was not stable due to missing screws. Altogether hilarious that this would be seen as suitable. The room had two clocks in the room both on the wrong time. The place had dirty walls, felt like I was in a dodgy place in Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced city stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very convenient location for going out at night and shopping the next day. Friendly staff, good breakfast, would definetly stay again for the price. The rooms are a bit samll but because we have advantage plus membership the rate was very reasonable for a saturday night in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our twin bedroom, although small, was clean with comfortable beds and no street noise. The buffet breakfast was most enjoyable. The staff were courteous and very helpful in returning (at no cost) my mobile phone charger which I had left in the bedroom. My only criticism of the room would be the thick build-up of dust on the air conditioner. I would stay there again when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “An utter disappointing impression of accor hotels”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at an accor hotel and I was utterly disaapointed. I travel regularly for seminars, and I had intended to join the accor hotel group and consolidate my accomodiation across the brands however given the lack of cleanliness, attention to detail and the overall standard of the room experienced in sydney on this first and only occasion I have chosen to consolidate my accomodation with another brand. The room was dirty, the bathroom mouldy and not up to any standard I would expect from a well reputed chain. The toilet was stained, the shower had cracked tiles, mould, and water marks all over. The mirror had marks and the floor was dirty around the edges.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: travellingtomtom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week when I moved to Sydney. On arriving early I was welcomed and kindly checked in straight away in to a twin room with two very small single beds in. I did not mind too much though was concerned I would fall out if I turned over in the night. Room was small but everything in working order. Great location to the CBD Museum station a short walk away Did not use breakfast facilities as so many other cafes to eat at. Clean basic and a good rate was a practical place to stay on a budget. No frills but clean and comfy

Reviews.Title: “great beds!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i am extremely picky when it comes to beds, especially hotel beds but at the IBIS i had the best sleep just like sleeping in my own bed! the room is clean and the staff are very friendly. the hotel is only a few steps away from everything you need. overall, my partner and i had an awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok to stay at but the breakfast was disgusting. Don't eat there. Scrambled eggs were inedible and choice is very limited. We ate at a McDonalds around the corner on the second day and it cost less with better food

Reviews.Title: “Not typical of an Ibis and quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: john117
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 25 mins walk from circular key but is only 5 mins walk from Museum train station which links directly with the airport (trains every 15 mins and take 15mins). The area is not brilliant but not quite â€œseedyâ€� though there is an adult book shop a few doors away. It is on the edge of Chinatown. The hotel has a sign on the door saying that you have to use your room card to open the exterior door after 23.00 but at weekends they seem to lock it earlier (19.00). The rooms are small (typical Ibis) and dated but reasonably clean. The bathroom was likewise tired and need of a refurbishment and had a shower but no bath. The room has a fridge (very noisy) and kettle with good supplies (replenished daily) of tea and coffee. It has aircon but the controller was damaged so it was difficult to operate. The plumbing was also noisy and we could hear water gushing through our room in the middle of the night presumably from the toilet of a room above. We could also hear the lift â€œding dongâ€� although our room was about as far away from the lift as was possible. Yes you guessed it we didnâ€™t sleep too well here even though our room was on the 14th floor well away from the traffic noise which I think would be bad on lower floors. We booked this hotel on the internet and didnâ€™t book breakfast at $20 each. There was a sign in reception offering breakfast for $12 if you booked and paid the night before. We resisted this also and went to the large Coles supermarket in World Square and got fresh croissants etc and some orange juice and did our own breakfast in the room. On your departure day donâ€™t expect this hotel to store your luggage for free. They have electronic lockers in the basement and each box is $7 for 24 hours or part of. The lockers are not that big so we reckoned we would have required 3 for our luggage. Fortunately check out is 12.00 so we didnâ€™t need to use them. Wi Fi has to be paid for also. The hotel also has a sign on the desk advising that they charge 1.5% extra on your bill for the use of credit cards which was not made clear on the original booking. I paid my bill part in cash (to get rid of it before we left Australia) and part on my credit card and they still tried to charge me 1.5% for the cash as well. I would not use this hotel again as it was pretty poor and definitely not cheap. I would recommend that the manager of this Ibis takes a trip to Singapore (which was our next port of call) and stay there for a few nights to see how it should be done. It is worth buying a 1 day â€œMulti passâ€� from 7/11 for $20 which gives you unlimited use of buses ferries trains etc. We went to Manly and round to Darling Harbour and it was a great view of the bridge and Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Keith Urban”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a Excellent location close to town and entertainment centre markets. Parking across the road resonably pricedThe staff were friendly and very helpful and the rooms are clean but we found the beds were a bit hard

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Ibis World Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: despite the small room and the connecting door to the next door room (one of my pet hates) the hotel was quite clean with good daily cleaning. The breakfast was very good and plentiful. Service was good at all levels. The hotel suits a certain market and I thought it does it quite well

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Ibis World Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal customer of Accor Hotels and have received a great service whenever I stayed with them in Europe. However, my experience with Ibis World Square Hotel between 21 to 23 March 2011 wasn't a good one in that, even though I made my reservation on 20 January 2011, and made a specific request for a Queen Standard room, I was given a room with two single beds. When I asked for a room with the appropriate bed I had reserved, I was told that all of the rooms with this facility were fully booked - not impressed after arriving fatigued at 21:00

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was old and looked "tired". The room was clean but very small. It was difficult getting into the lobby late at night due to lots of people on the strret for the pub next door. Overall, I do not beileve it offered value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I didn't mind the hotel except for the airconditioning. The controls were broken and falling off the wall. We rang for assistance and they turned the airconditioning on at reception but we had no way of controlling it so we were either sweltering or freezing. The controls and the unit desperately needed replacing. The bathroom wasn't spotless and was in need of updating and the carpet either needed replacing or a damn good clean. I am sure I noticed these things more due to being uncomfortable in temperature. When the room was very hot it was stuffly and smelly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: catchme79
Reviews.Content: After reading every review for Sydney hotels I chose this one and I wasn't dissappointed! It was slap bang in the middle of the city and opposite a shopping mall and easy access to everywhere. We had a deal on the room which was 4 nights for the price of 3. We stayed for 4 nights and were on the 9th floor. You could hear the traffic but it didn't bother us as we wore ourselves out sightseeing each day. Reception staff were very friendly and efficient and helped us with our bags to the room. The rooms were basic but had everything you would need - tea & coffee, ensuite, fridge, hairdryer, iron, big tv etc. They were cleaned everyday and supplies topped up. Sydney is expensive but opposite the hotel there is a supermarket underneath the shopping mall so you can stock up on drinks and snacks there. Lot's of cafe's and takeaways along Pitt St so you are spoilt for choice. I found if you walk through the Mall to the next street there was more choice in food (pizza hut was a life saver) and if you carry on walking across you will soon come to the Chinese friendship garden which leads to Darling Harbour. Go right out of the hotel for Circular Quay which was about a 20 minute walk and really nice if you go through Hyde Park. Go left out of the hotel for Central Station which is about 5 - 10 min walk. Due to it's location this hotel was excellent and it was nice to start and end the day in the middle of the city so you don't have to go to far to see things.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aloushka
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel after attending a concert in town, which finished late into the evening. The hotel is located between Museum Station and Central Station (not the best part of town), but price wise this hotel suited my budget. On arrival, I noticed that the staff were friendly and efficient. I had requested a quiet and non-smoking room and discovered I had been allocated a room that was on a floor full of "party animals" and you could hear everything going on between the walls. The room was clean, but small (not good if you are spending a lot of time inside this hotel), plus the air conditioner made a "rattling" sound when turned on and the electric kettle was dirty, with black particles floating in it that I couldn't get rid of (a note to the Manager to buy some new kettles please). I requested that Reception move me to another room (which they happily did so) and my second room, was definitely much quieter, with a better view and a lot bigger too, but the air-conditioner, even in that room, also rattled. Use this hotel only if you are on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney in February”
Reviews.Author: LeRoyboy_Detroit Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis was an excellent hotel to enjoy our five day vacation in Sydney from. We could walk to the Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour/Kings Wharf, Chinatown with ease. Enjoyed shopping for water, beer/wine at the mall across the street. Very friendly, helpful staff, delicious breakfast buffet. Plan to return on our next vacation to Sydney and stay at the Ibis for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Best to avoid”
Reviews.Author: gargamit100
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of worst hotels I have stayed in recent times - specially given the price you pay for it. The rooms are small, TV is up on the wall, AC made noise and had a cumbersome control, wall are wafer thin (the guest next door requested me to turn the TV volume down even though it wasn't very loud), locker facility is charged for and the lockers themselves are poorly designed (had to lift a 20+ kg bag 4 ft high to slide it into the locker).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lorilola
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Ibis World Square for 8 nights over Christmas. It has a great location, being less than 15 minutes from everything you'd want to see in the centre of Sydney. It is about 5 minutes from Museum Station and 10 minutes from Central Station, so very easy to get to from the airport. The rooms are clean and functional, with flat screen TVs and reasonably sized bathrooms (with only a shower, no bath). I was horribly jet lagged when arriving in Sydney and the rooms were quiet and comfortable which was very welcome. I would liken it to a Travelodge. The staff were very helpful and were always willing to give maps, directions and information on transport which was a bonus. The only downside was that you had to pay for luggage storage after check out. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Tripper1811027
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here because it was close to town & the brochure showed a lovely room. The staff most of the time were not pleasant or helpful.We were put into the wrong room to start with then we were put in a room on the smoker's floor, the bed had dirty sheets on it the first night, the room was very small. We have stayed at other Ibis Hotels before and this is the worst one ever. We were there for four days but it was a nightmare. I would certainly not recommend this to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy neighbours”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: You could hear the people in the room next door. I thought that the rooms were small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice, clean room”
Reviews.Author: raquel123london Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights in this hotel in Feb-11 and I would recommend it. Great location with lots of restaurants around and clean, nice rooms. The staff very very helpful: My friend forgot her camera in our room and they posted it back to her at our next hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs painting”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fittings etc were clean and well presented, but was let down by the need for a repaint. The walls and doors looked like they were dirty, but weren't. Provided value for money & I'd stay there again. It was also quiet. Rated very good due to price

Reviews.Title: “sydney central”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: budget price accommodation ...... central sydney location.................

Reviews.Title: “The forgotten hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beds not made properly, shower too low, Buffet Breakfast low standard not enough staff the waiter who was on Craig did a great job under the circumstances. air con in room pathetic .

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and paid 134 AUD per night. I have stayed nearby at the Best Western Stellar, Travelodge and Rydges World Square and would rate Ibis as my least favourite among these. I tried it because the price was slightly lower. The location is very good and I slept well but overall the feel of the place was a bit downmarket. That said they let me check in early and the staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was the first time i have stayed at an Ibis in Aust., being an Accor member gave me a discount for a prepaid stay which was an absolute bargain, very good reception staff, friendly & efficient staff all around hotel,comfy beds, clean rooms, fantastic central position close to all you need to enjoy Sydney, I will make it my base anytime i am staying overnight or a long weekend. Janet Orange

Reviews.Title: “Never Again, Even for $1million”
Reviews.Author: shrek73
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms over a friday and saturday night and given this properties location and chain affiliation, we were happy tp pay $400 for each room for two nights, prior to arrival that is. Service upon check in was quite reasonable. Upon going into the rooms we soon discovered that the airconditioners in both rooms seemed to be not functioning as they should. Given that this particular weekend saw the temperature in Sydney rise to over 40 degrees celsius each day and not fall below 28 degrees celsius each night, this was a problem. The control for the air conditioner was showing 16 degrees, however we bought a thermometer and it showed 29 degrees. We informed reception, and were told they would reset it from reception for us. After 15 years in hospitality, I have never heard this before. Anyway, we accepted this and went out for the day. Upon our return to the room, nothing had changed at all. But as the hotel was full, we had no choice but to put up with it. In the morning we insisted on room changes. This was given. Problem was nothing changed, the air conditioner was just as useless in the new rooms. To make matters worse, the sheets on the bed and the mattress protector were stained with yellow marks!!! I use two pillows and found the second one in the cupboard to also be stained and actually have on it some short and curly hairs. Upon complaining to reception, nothing was done and it seemed a bother for the staff there. The only solution for us was to find an all night bar with good air conditioning and stay there all night until our flight home. Disgraceful as a whole. Upon check out we heard many other guests complaining of the same things For such a well know chain not to care is a concern. Perhaps it is because they are so big, they dont need to care You can rest assured I will never stay at another Accor property as long as i have breath in my body

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with very good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for someone who comes to Sydney to get out and see things and wants to come back to a comfy hotel to change, shower and go out at night and then to come back, sleep, shower, eat breakfast and start another day. There are numerous pubs within a few blocks to provide evening entertainment and interaction. The train station is 3 blocks away, Hyde Park 2 blocks away, Pitt Street Mall (center of the shopping district) 10 minute walk, the financial district, Town Hall, Parliament and other sights 10-20 minute walk, Circular Quay and the Rocks 20-25 minute walk. All the downtown sights are within an easy walk. If you are the type that wants to brag to people about the expensive, luxurious hotel you stayed and not what you saw or did, stay away from this hotel. (You should have stayed at home anyway!)

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: ashlee888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights. The air conditioning was useless and was dripping water on my head as i slept! If we were staying any longer we would have found another hotel. Beds and pillows are very uncomfortable.The tap in the shower fell off and the movie channel didn't work. Good location. Close to transport, food, shops etc. Will never stay here again and would not reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: deb255100
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on the 14th floor, room clean, and had everything we needed, ipod docking, large flat screen were pleasant extras. The bathroom was small, towels and sheets seemed very new. The only downside was that the hotel charges $7.00 per case to hold after checkout, i have never heard of this before. The staff very helpful and always had a smile, a great stay and would gladly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideMiss_p
Reviews.Content: will never stay here again!! soon as we walked through the door, staff was very rude as we complained about our booking prior to our stay. as we needed to cancel our booking but they would not refund anything back. so from then they were really rude, did not feel welcome at all. the rooms looks dirty, the floors smelt funny and dirty linen was shoved in the hotel lobby after the cleaners wer cleaning rooms. no basket or anything. just straight on the floor for there guests to see ! lucky we did not spend much time in there. eww. on the bright side its convient, the hotel was cheap and the lady that greeted us on checkout was the only nice one

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight. Good value hotel in Sydney. Close to transport and shops. Staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms ..”
Reviews.Author: lookingstylist
Reviews.Content: If you like sleeping in a broom cupboard then you will like this hotel. Bathroom is really tiny and the shower needs a good scrub,to much mould for my liking.Take your own hair dryer unless you have an extra 1 hour to dry your hair.(useless) Not enough cupboard space in the bedroom and no where in the bathroom to put your toiletries. If you dont want to sleep then its ok. You hear every door opening and banging all night. The room was so hot and the air conditioner is so old and noisy and pre set. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was forced to stay here as there was something on in the city and my usual hotel was booked out. While the service was good, the rooms were shabby. I booked a Queen and got a twin (was told that there were no Queen beds available unless I wanted to go on the stinky smoking floor)...although I had booked weeks in advance. Apparently, they don't care and don't take this into consideration....if someone walks in off the street before you arrive and request a Queen bed, they will get it - regardless of whether you've got one booked or not. I'd NEVER stay there again. Shame on you Accor...this hotel was dirty for my standards (which aren't that high in the first place!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location to restaurants and close to where I have to go. Should consider having a shoe shine machine as I have colleagues from Europe who uses them regularly in hotels. Our next booking will be in hotels who has this service.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for proximity to darling harbour and access to shops, restaurants. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, rooms although small had all that you needed and were clean. Excellent for a short stay in the city with everything within walking distance. Would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Travelman2500
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel when Bon Jovi were in town playing at the Sydney Football Stadium. Stayed in their basic room, pre booked months in advance at a cheap rate $89 per night (AUS) Room was small, especially the shower section, but overall was quite acceptable if your on a budget. Had signs of wear and tear, but was clean and efficent for a solo traveller Coles supermarket is across the road (downstairs at World Square. Lots of 7/11 and 24/7 convienient shops around the place. Hotel Ibis World Square is in a good location. Not far from Central and town hall train stations. About 10 min walk to Darling Harbour. One real annoying thing is, you have to walk past reception to get to and fro the lifts to your room. They seem to have a lot of staff working here, and most would just stare at you as you walk by as some sort of criminal. A courtesy hello, or good morning wouldnt go astray Overall would stay here again, But only if undner $100 per night

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service,very unfriendly front desk”
Reviews.Author: marjafriend
Reviews.Content: The people at reception were the most unfriendly I ever encountered at a hotel. And I have been to some very cheap budget hotels. They were very rude, and absolutely not willing to provide a smile or to make you feel comfortable. Breakfast was 20(!) dollar, so we ate breakfast in a cafe across the street. For 20 dollar you could have there a very royal meal, and it was served to you instead of a buffet. The rooms were ok, nothing special. Leaving your luggage is a nightmare,they have lockers wich cost 7 dollar. Doesn't matter if you use them for an hour or a day.These are in the basement of the hotel.The worst part is that you cannot choose the level of the locker you want to use.(wich was possible in another hotel we stayed) So I(small girl) had to lift 2 20 kg bags 1,8 meter high! There's nobody to assist you. And you know that only after you already payed. The street were the hotel is located looks a bit run down. We also stayed in a youth hostel in Sydney, at central station. The service provided there was much better, and the rooms were of the same quality. I'm never ever going to an Ibis hotel again, it's a pity I cannot cancel my next booked stay with another Ibis hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Place old rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very much in need of a upgrade! First room we got stank of smoke. Air Cond in second room very noisy. Close to everything and breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Accor Gift Card - Didn't Listen When I booked”
Reviews.Author: SandroTozzi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had an Accor Gift Card and rang the hotel to book and make sure my credit card was not charged. They assured me the credit details was only used to secure the booking. Upon arrival it was charged and they couldn't reverse it out and use the Gift Card! Not happy!

Reviews.Title: “Maintenance required”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The air conditioner was noisy. When you left the room and removed your card, the fridge was turned off, which meant no ice when you returned, or worse, your food not kept cold.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Ibis World Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at the Ibis World Square when in Sydney because of its price and location. However the rooms are good, it is quiet and the service is always friendly. It was not always like this but over the last 2 years the service and friendliness of staff has improved greatly. I recommend it as a great place to stay when you need to be in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Room too small for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in for two night was way too small for the money I paid for it. The Air Conditioning didn't work properly and it was un comfortable. If I only paid $100 a night I wouldn't have cared. I was quoted $30 a night for parking and when I paid for the parking before I left it cost me $122.............NOT HAPPY

Reviews.Title: “Old, Messy & Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located in an awkward part of Sydney, this hotel failed to deliver on almost every aspect. From the mould in the Shower to the lack of attentiveness of the staff (3 requests were made to reception to bring up fresh towels, which never eventuated.) Was reassured that this hotel awarded frequent flyer points, only to be informed by Qantas that this was not the case. Never Again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: justabloke
Reviews.Content: Not really much to say. It's a hotel, the rooms were of average size but clean. The bathroom like so many was small. My only complaint was that the grouting in the floor tiles need a damn good scrub. Had to change rooms because the air-con in the first one stopped working. The staff were great and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: RocSydney Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel room was small but clean & the staff were very helpful & friendly. Only draw back is that it is a fair distance from The Rocks, Circular Quay areas. So a cab ride can cost up to $14AUD each way if you don't take rail or bus.

Reviews.Title: “OK budget hotel but there's a funny smell”
Reviews.Author: Virginifer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for business. Rooms are neat and tidy. Beds are quite comfortable. There is a fair amount of street noise. I could hear people shouting on the streets at 3am. In a backpacker-ish part of town. Close to Chinatown. The main thing is that the hotel had a musty smell, which after you've been in the room for a few hours you don't notice.

Reviews.Title: “..”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great with service. In the room we stayed in the toilet wouldnt flush sometimes. the fridge door wasn't attached properly. other than that everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Everything”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was poor in quality, service and cleanliness. Shower had mould on floor....long wait period for service......no character or personality from staff even that they did not activate room key and we had to chase them. A poor way to start our cruise vacation from Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “No”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I felt that the facilities to make a cup of coffee were substandard and the amount of milk given to use was too small.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Astrobop
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in one of the Accor group hotels and I was optimistic that being part of a big chain the standards would be high. However this hotel fell short on many basic counts. The room I was given was tiny just big enough to fit a double bed, the bathroom (shower room ) was miniscule and the room had minimal cupboard space so I could not attempt to unpack. It also had poor noise insulation. It is tiresome to try to sleep while listening to evaluator ring every time it arrived and listening to the cleaning staff making a racket from 7am was similarly disturbing. The general decor and standards of the hotel are best summed up by the pile of dirty towels and bedding placed outside of my room every morning and itâ€™s just shoddy. In terms of theâ€� extrasâ€� again the hotel fell short. The equipment in the fitness room was dated; the fridge in the room didnâ€™t work, the bathroom towels had seen better days and Internet access was expensive (especially as there in free wifi across the road in the World Square Centre). It is supposedly classed as 3 Â½ stars but in my mind itâ€™s a 2 star hotel at best. Generally it was not a comfortable stay and I found myself not wanting to spend any time in the hotel. I would not recommend it and I would not stay at any Accor hotel if this is representative of their standards.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Convenient location for our weekend in Sydney however the hotel room and bathroom were both tiny. The hotel was cleanish but would really benefit from a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Poor Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Handy to transport and easy access. Room was clean enough but hallways and exterior doors were grubby and poorly kept. Amenaties were also poor.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS WORLD SQUARE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but neat & spoyless Good breakfasts, Gym compact with all you need treadmill good

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Square Sydney 10 days trapped in the Central City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What a great location this was for me as my business was only round the corner. Across the road from World Square shopping centre open long hours, and many great pubs on the other corners to eat at after a long day. My room was small but perfect for myself, and was serviced beautifully every day. I slept well with earplugs. The hotel was clean and always being cleaned in the hallways etc. The staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was lovely in the restaurant. Gym and business area clean and well maintained. Food and drink was always available from reception all hours. Internet available as required. Will definitely go back again and stay. Thanks to all staff that gave me a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre Outing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis World Square is easy to get to from Central rail station which is an attraction for people using the country train system. The room is OK for a short stay. The location is very handy to theatres and shops and a nice walk to many other attractions in the city of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Handy inner city hotel. close to all transport. Clean ,comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis-pay for the location!”
Reviews.Author: shazam7 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis room we stayed is functional, compact and frills free. It is in need of refurbishment as the carpet, walls and some of the furniture is showing its age. The price we paid was steep for what the room is - so I can only assume we are paying for the location, which is super central.

Reviews.Title: “Variable service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: personnel service varied between excellent (most desk staff & breakfast staff) to rude and demeaning (one male desk staff member). This was especially embarrassing and distressing for our guests from Germany (who arrived jetlagged the day after we arrived) who were spoken to as though they were simpletons. They may not have a good grasp of English, but both are professional people and the tone and language used to them was inappropritae and insulting. In other circumstances I would checked out of the hotel and gone else where. If that male desk staff member had spoken to me that way I would have complained most vehemently and been likely to confront him aggressively, but we did not want to create a scene or worse impression for our guests.. The male staff member at the breakfast room was very welcoming, pleasant and helpful. His attitude and approach went a long way to making up for the unpleasant welcome that our friends had. The female desk staff members at check out were also very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Make sure next time that the cleaner or room service knows whether someone is in the room or not before even knocking. As i did not appreciate the knock at about 8am and again about an hour later.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked the IBIS for the first week (holiday) of a 3 week combined holiday and business trip and found the hotel superb, and the staff amongst the most helpful, courteous and friendly I have ever come across. I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to any visitor to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable city centre hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: waterman17
Reviews.Content: On arrival immediately a bit put off by quite a small reception area full of people waiting around, and our room wasn't yet ready, but after dropping off our luggage and walking around for an hour, we could enter our room. Pleasantly suprised by the room, clean and fairly modern, and the rest of the hotel was similar, not exceptional but fine for the price budget. Staff were friendly. Only problem was that in spite of ticking the "no further marketing contact" box on the entry form, I seem to have been signed up for the Accor hotels club membership. In spite of trying to withdraw from this unwanted "prize" I keep getting "spammed" and contacted by them.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very central and staff very friendly. Room very small and bathroom claustrophic but over all a nice friendly atmosphere with very helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price with execellent location”
Reviews.Author: v01606344
Reviews.Content: Location : Execellent, near world square mall, a minute walk to china town and george street Staff: Friendly and helpful Cleanliness: could be improved, dirt on bed sheets and carpet, especailly the hair dryer~ Rooms: comfortable and cozy but no free internet, i have to pay AUD$4 for half an hour internet servie in business centre You can store your personal belongings in their locker for AUD $7 per day

Reviews.Title: “Showing Overseas Visitors Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of the CBD in Sydney. Very close to Chinatown, transport and easy accessable to all parts of the City. The World Sqaure is across the road with lots of shopping and a parking station with one entry and one exit at $30 or $30 a Day which is very reasonable. The rooms are moderate to small but very clean and tidy and reception staff are very friendly and helpful. The only minus is the reception area is very small and they do not have anywhere to store your luggage if your plane or ship leaves late.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at the Ibis World Square. Position and cleanliness is how I would describe Ibis World Square. The room was not large but spacious enough. All facilities were in excellent working order and staff were friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: bluechilli8
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend in a room with 2 single beds on the 12th floor. The room is small but if you're out and about all day like we were, you don't need it any bigger. A stand alone shower in the bathroom is definately a bonus and the water pressure was nice. The room got a little hot on the first night but you have your own a/c unit so that was easily fixed. I am a light sleeper and I know we were in the middle of the city but the rooms did seem a bit noisy. not sure if the windows would benefit from some double glazing. rooms a little tired looking, especially the bathroom but with the amount of people that must stay there every year, wear and tear is going to happen. check in was easy, we arrived at midday and our room was ready which was great. Check out was also very quick. The staff are able to book the airport connect shuttle for you for $12 per person. Tea and coffee was replaced in the morning. The location is fantastic! Across the road is the world square shopping complex with a coles so you can buy supplies. The hotel has lockers for baggage at a cost of $7 for 24hours. Big enough for most suitcases but not all. Most hotels offer to hold bags for free so this could be something to improve on. For the price we paid for the location and the amount of time we stayed in the rooms, can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: goldenoldie12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week with the Golden Oldies and had a blast. The staff are so much fun and nothing was a problem. The rooms are that of a 3.5 star hotel but the location is fantastic, walking distance to China town, Darling Harbour and the free bus 555 on George Street FANTASTIC....

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at this hotel unless there's nowhere else to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: freq_biz_travel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Never again! Hotel was dreadful. Mould in shower. Blood stain on bathroom wall. Dirty sink. Old funiture in bedroom. Not at all pleasant or cheap for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: higvin Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sadly, the other poor reviews are consistent with my experience. Wotif regularly advertises rooms here for under $200 claiming the full rate is $479. That full rate and the Ibis website suggest this is a smart, modern hotel. But even the discounted rate seems steep. My room was poky and tired and the hotel corridors were shabby. Amazingly, the (very necessary) air conditioner could only be switched on by reception. The reception area is also not what you expect - small and a bit too close to the footpath at the seedier end of Pitt Street.

Reviews.Title: “A++++”
Reviews.Author: Aspiring_Traveler28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is value for money (we booked online on special) and excellent for location, right in the heart of the city, really central and close to everywhere, room is clean but small, everything about this hotel is small and minimal, even the service. Came across as being short-staffed and we as guests felt like we were staying at a hostel, where everything was self service and we had to be self sufficient as service was not provided. Overall not counting the service, this hotel is recommended for value, location and cleanliness but don't expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “a warm welcome with a friendly staff that made me feel at home”
Reviews.Author: ManxkittenScotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis world square for two weeks and would stay there again. what a lovely place to stay on my first trip to sydney. The staff were professional and always helpful. They made my trip with friendly advise and places to see. Nothing was a bother to them. The hotel had a good location and was good for local shops especially Coles shopping market and small gift shops. A special thanks to Kartina and Ralph who went that extra mile to make me feel welcome as a lone traveller is was lovely to be greeted as a a member of the "family" and not as a stranger as i have found in so many other hotels. The bar area was small but friendly enough to have a coffee or wine while waiting to go out. To one and all a big thank you and I hope to visit you all again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Close to lots, but no cigar”
Reviews.Author: fuzz46
Reviews.Content: Agree with other reviews of this hotel. It is well located, but.... the staff are friendly but non-caring; room was smaller than envisaged and needed a good clean; woodwork was filthy and there were only 3 pillows for two people. The shower was absolutely filthy, and my request to have it cleaned after our first use was accepted readily with lots of promises, but it was never touched in the four days we stayed at the hotel, and it clearly had not been cleaned before we arrived. The bathroom walls, tiles were suspiciously dirty, and the doors etc needed a thorough clean. Disappointing, as this hotel was recommended as a good budget, and well located hotel by Flight Centre. We agree with others, the 'bar' is a joke. Hotel website says breakfast until midday but this is not true...all off by 10.00 am.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Achim02
Reviews.Content: The Ibis World Square is a convenient hotel in Sydney. Chinatown, Paddy's Market, Darling Harbour, Central Station and the Sydney Tower are sights you can easily walk to. A little bit further you'll find the Opera and the Harbour Bridge. The rooms are not overwhelming, but okay. It simply has a good value and therefore is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it say on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: 255112JoJo
Reviews.Content: We wanted budget accomodation as close to the CBD as possible and that is what we got. The room and bathroom were clean. The location was excellent walking distance to all attractions which we wanted to visit. The only issue we had was late night revellers coming in on the Sunday morning at 5am making a noise but this is to be expected! If you want to stay in a hotel close to the CBD and not having to spend a fortune this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: worldygirl
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel. I read the reviews before i booked it and thought this would be good, but it was awful. The reception area small and yes the bar is an extension of the reception area. The reception area wasn't even cozy even though there were chairs to sit in, it was cold from the front door being right there and loud from the street. Checkin agent was not friendly. The hallways were dirty and walls scratched, the room was so small, even for 2 beds. The lock on the door was loose, not even tightly bolted to the wall. Bathroom was small but actually clean, but no where to put accesories and toiletries. One towel for two people, that just doesn't work!! We called downstairs and asked for extra towels and an extra pillow and blankets, since the beds basically only had sheets on them and it was Fall weather and raining so it was a little cool out and the heating unit hung right above one of the beds and was dirty, there was no way that was going to be turned on. The reception agent brought us our extra stuff, not even housekeeping. We actually got an extra pillow and towels but a bedspread, not a blanket, a bedspread. I asked her what is that and she said its an extra blanket, i said no its a bedspread and thats nasty, and she said we don't have anymore extra blankets. The breakfast wasn't that great, except the potatoe wedges were actually decent, but the eggs were awful, can't even descibe the taste. I am a travel agent and even got a travel agent rate which was not very discounted, but this hotel will not be recommended by me. Yes, the location was good but thats about it. We searched for another hotel that night and checked out the next day and moved onto another hotel. The night I spent here wasn't even worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: will2themax
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, bathrooms are small and has no soap holders in the shower! Some suspicious stains on the blanket and suitcase holders. Staff friendly and helpful. Nothing like what is pictured on the website.

Reviews.Title: “POOR”
Reviews.Author: alongcamepolly074
Reviews.Content: This is the most souless hotel I have ever stayed in, granted, it is central, but that's it's only good point. The 'bar' is a complete joke, I mean, it isn't even a bar, it is basically an extension of the reception desk and has all of two, yes two bar stools!!!Alcohol choice is very limited (no brandy:( ) rooms are very small and walls paper thin. It just, but only just, passes muster on the cleanliness front. Would be suitable for backpackers or lone businessmen/women, as it is in the heart of the city. My stay there was totally miserable and my advice is ........ look elsewhere............you have been warned!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - very quiet room”
Reviews.Author: macapital
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night and left early for the airport. Had concerns over noise as hotel on Pitt St., but very quiet in the room. Room was clean and in order. Would stay again if we needed a CBD hotel close to Central Station..

Reviews.Title: “Tourist hotel which is good value”
Reviews.Author: Riverdale17
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not large, in fact they are pretty small but the price of this hotel compares favourably with others in Sydney so if you are price conscious this is a good option. Sydney centre is pretty small and we walked from the hotel right down to the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. There is a free sightseeing bus service but beware of limited hours of operation - reception has details. Good Asian restaurants within easy reach of the hotel. We did not go for the breakfast option which seemed expensive. There are plenty of bakeries just a few steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old buidling and average interior..Great Location though”
Reviews.Author: mdTokyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in mid March 2010. We saw mixed reviews about the hotel on internet but finally chose the hotel beacuase of its location that is right in the heart of CBD.And believe me it is very very convenient.Considering we had our 2.5 yr old son with us, who at times just refused to walk anymore..The location was really great. About 20 minutes walking from circular quay. Chek-in was fast and neatly done.Our room was on 3rd floor and and did not have any view.A big wall of adjacent building was obstructing the view from the window completely.The room was enough spacious and neatly made up.Though the interior and Airconditioner could be better. The bathroom tiles were pretty old and not particularly clean looking. One more particulaly annying thing was the fixed shower head.Hand held shower head was absent so even after taking a shower the feeling of cleanliness was not there. Conclusion:Best for location but if you are looking forward to a comfy stay..go pick something else.Best value for money though not a true Ibisu in its standard and design.

Reviews.Title: “Average, somewhat dated interior features, not a typical Ibis”
Reviews.Author: sergio2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights in late March 2010. Was a bit worried as I had seen the mixed reviews, however at the special on offer the price was right so I decided to go and see for myself anyway. The hotel is located right in the CBD which makes it very convenient location-wise. Check in was fast, friendly and efficient (by a guy called Michael if I remember well), and even though I was around two hours before the official check-in time a room was available. The room was on the 16th floor and looked out at surrounding office and apartment towers (many of which are much higher than the hotel) and some bits of street below - this part of Sydney has many highrises so long-distance views are practically impossible. By now I was wondering why this hotel has such mixed reviews. My experience was not bad, however having stayed at a number of Ibis hotels both in Europe and in Brazil (but never before in Australia), my expectation of a "typical Ibis" in the way I am used to in Europe and Brazil was not met. Whilst the room size (room 1603) was similar to Ibis hotels elsewhere, the room lacked the standardisation and modernity of other Ibis hotels I stayed at. People from overseas who expect a "typical Ibis" may thus be disappointed. A few items in particular that caught my eye and that would be quite different in modern overseas Ibis hotels include the carpet, which in this hotel is of a colour and pattern on which every stain and blemish is visible; the tiles in the bathroom, which are typical of older Australian bathrooms with a lot of grout between them which was not sealed off so it tends to discolour over time in areas which are used, giving the impression of being dirty (darker grout where people walk, and lighter towards the edges; although from the smell and clear presence of detergent I am sure my bathroom floor was pretty clean); tiles which have a top surface that is probably for anti-slip purposes, but which can give a "greasy" sensation when soap or detergent is on it; bathroom lighting which was strange, in that the light near the mirror was halogen (which shows all skin blemishes and thus is "unflattering"), plus placed too far back from the mirror so shaving is a bit of a "catch the light" exercise; a shower head that is fixed in place and cannot be turned; toilet flush buttons that have to be pressed with force quite deeply and held there to flush the toilet. Other than those items which are essentially fairly major interior design flaws, I had no serious problems with my stay or the room. The bed was comfortable with crisp sheets, there was a working desk area (with the usual-for-Accor comparatively pricey Internet connection which I did not use), a cupboard to hang suit and shirts, a small fridge and a mid-size flat panel TV which however in my room did not work (I don't normally watch TV, tried to switch it on just to see what it was like, the red light on the TV was on and stayed on, the remote blinked a green light, but nothing happened). The air conditioning was weird with one heatpump-style outlet and one ducted-aircon style outlet. The heatpump-style one was old and not working but appeared to be switched on. The air came out of the ducted outlet. However despite setting the temperature to 16 degrees the room was never much cooler than around 22 degrees. Sufficient, but not really as it should be.
