Room service was OK, a Nepalese girl was very friendly and changed the towels and the bins when I saw her in the corridor and asked her to do this, even though it was not a room she was supposed to service. On the last day an hour before checkout time one male staff member barged into the room one second after knocking, surprised I was still there, apologised then did it again half an hour later. Staff training clearly needs to be improved in this area (knock, wait for people to answer before storming in). Overall conclusion: acceptable hotel, not a true Ibis in my view, staff are friendly. Some things (like the carpet and most items in the bathroom) appear to be less clean or are less functional than they should be due to bad choice, and age of, materials used. To make it a true Ibis they would need to do a full refurbishment, ripping out the bathrooms as well as most of the room interiors and replacing them with Ibis-standard materials which have a cleaner and more modern look, etc. I would stay here again for its location, but the if I can find a similar hotel down the road for less I would stay there - the hotel does not have any particular appeal (also because of its lack of Ibis brand qualities - image of smooth cleanliness, highly standardised design, modern - which is one of the reasons I normally choose to stay at Ibis hotels).

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel for our trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Park2010
Reviews.Content: We travelled to sydney as part of our honeymoon for New Years. We've been to Oz before but as backpackers and thought it fitting to return for our honeymoon. When I booked the hotels across Oz in January 2009 I wasn't quite prepared for the astronomical prices that were to be charged in Sydney over New Years. But of course it is an extremley sought after destination around that time of year. If I knew then what I know now I would have done it differently. For example we arrived 30th December for 3 nights. Our charges were as follows: 30th December $239 31st December $479 1st January $149. The 1st January charge is generally the average cost for most nights accomodation. You can see how much it jumped up over New Years which was to be expected but my advice.....on New Years Eve day and night we were never in our room. The hotel did have a storage facilit y for luggage at something like $25 a day. What I would have done.....booked on the 30th and 1st January only. Put luggage in storage for the 31st and saved $420!!! You can easily stay up all night in Sydney on New's Years. Even if they charged more on New Years for luggage storage it would still be cheaper than what we paid. Aside from that rooms were ok. Small and basic but ok as a base. Its a good 25 minute walk at a fair pace to the harbour area so if don't like walking dont book that far out. There is a train stop reasonably close by as an alternative. The surrounding area has some nice Irish bars but not alot else. The hotel itself was reasonably quiet. The breakfast area which we only used once, wasn't the nicest but enabled you to eat. I would recommend forgetting it and having breakfast out. I would however next time try elsewhere if I am honest only for the fact it wasn't nice enough to return too when there are other hotels to try.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: BiztravelGermany
Reviews.Content: Service was extremely poor, check-in took forever even though two people were involved. They messed up our reservation and only had a smooking room availabe which was a nightmare, hardly any sleep due to the bad smell. Rooms are also extremely small.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and very adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kinnoda
Reviews.Content: Apart from only being offered a room on the first floor, my night's stay was rather enjoyable. The bed was extremely comfortable and I didn't really want to get out of bed in the morning. The shower was nice and refreshing after a long flight and a big day (I checked in late at night). Phone reception was great, which is something I often find a problem in places that I stay, although this may be attributed to being on the first floor. No Mini-Bar which I found disappointing, and a guide to the hotel and how to use the television would have been fantastic (wasn't sure how to take it off of pay to view). Vents in roof also need cleaning, they're rather dirty, especially the one in the bathroom. Thankfully I'm not asthmatic! But other than these small critiques, the location is fantatic and everything around me was very easy to walk to. Would stay again for a short one or two night stay, but maybe not for too much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: umsums
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is located in a convenient area, very clean and has wonderful staff look no further. The Ibis has it all.

Reviews.Title: “don't go near it”
Reviews.Author: koolmodine
Reviews.Content: Awful hotel...second review we have written first has vanished.What a surprise. Arrived from UK to find quality of room we had booked and paid for 4 months earlier was not available. Offered an inferior room at no reduced cost. Air conitioning didn't work, was even turned onto heat on a day when the temperature were 37 degrees: we are used to 10. Had to constantly contact reception to have the room temperature adjusted. Reception kept blaming it on the cleaners. Spent the night cooling down with hankeys in the fridge...at least the fridge was working. On the day we departed reception staff were surly and we were left to our own devices as to which hotel transport we were to get on for the airport. Have stayed in several Ibis Hotels around the world. This is the worst and won't stay in another

Reviews.Title: “OK, no better”
Reviews.Author: EssexTrilobite
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, I expected this place to be a total dump. That wasn't entirely borne out by our experience. The hotel is shabby, probably unacceptably so for a large chain, even at the budget end and our room was poky. That said, the air conditioning was adequate, the shower good and the TV channels OK. We were allowed to book in early (on New Years Day), asked for (and were given) a room on the 14th (or 16th) floor - so no noise from the disco, and there was no noise from neighbouring rooms. It was expensive on 1/2 January, but we saved a lot by flying out from the UK on 30 December - so swings and roundabouts. The cleaning was a bit cursory on the first night. I would not recommend this hotel but we didn't have a bad experience. PS - plese don't respond with "I'm glad you enjoyed your stay". It was OK, no better, but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs - Beware”
Reviews.Author: Elaria
Reviews.Content: The Ibis World Square is not a hotel I would revisit. Whilst the location is fantastic and the room small but suitable the level of cleanliness is disgusting. The bathroom contained mould, the floor of the shower felt very dirty and to top it off - bed bugs were present. It was not pleasent to be woken by a bug crawling up my leg to discover more under my pillow and that of my room mate. Whilst the hotel did shift our location they were not helpful in this process. There was no offer to move our bags and no offer of a refunded nights accomodation. I note the hotel manager comments on any negative review on this site - Michelle your staff were not suprised by our complaint and it appeared you filled the room on the same day we left it - was it fumigated first?? I doubt it. Stay at this hotel if you enjoy wildlife.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: michaeltaylor767
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location walking distance to all main events the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and always had time to help us, i would deffinantly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GGBritGirl
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several IBIS Hotels worldwide we chose this hotel for the first 4 days of our stay in Sydney. We had an early check in due to an early international arrival in Sydney after a 25 hour flight, needless to say we were exhausted. When entering the room it was on the 1st floor, that was the first problem as it looked akin to a prison cell with only a brick wall to look out the window at. The sheets appeared clean and so we just crawled into bed for the long awaited rest that we needed. Later we were about to shower when we examined the absolutely appalling state of the towels that looked as if they had been used as floor cloths, like rags with bare thread, nasty colour etc.. Upon closer inspection we also found an empty water bottle under the bed and someones 'used' deoderant bottle left behind in a plastic bad, these items should most definitely have been removed by housekeeping. We also noticed hairs on the floor in the bathroom and the general condition of the room was poor to say the least. We immediately spoke with the manager who came up to the room herself and was amazed at the horrible condition of the towels, along with agreeing that the noisy air condition was also ineffective. She comped 60 dollars off the room and upon me asking her agreed to comp the internet daily charge of a whopping 18 dollars!! We were offered a room move for later in the day but instead as we had unpacked asked if this room could be serviced for us properly to save us any added inconvenience. This was carried out and became an 'acceptable' state for our stay. The location is fantastic for everything but that's where it stops. The breakfast charge was at one stage put up to 20 dollars, (not worth it) and a few days later reduced to 13 dollars, what does that tell you. This hotel needs to be looked at for it's standards by IBIS and is in serious need of better standards generally.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is only out for money”
Reviews.Author: donegal90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 7th december and also on 16th to 18th November last.The internet access was chargeable.There was also a charge to leave luggage and the breakfast at a cost of 17.50 au dollars was not worth getting up for.The choices were very limited and compared to other IBIS Hotels,the standard was way down.The bar in the hotel was right next to the reception desk and was no way inviting.how could you converse with such noise of people checking in and out all the time.Thestaff did not seem to care when I mentioned my queries re the above.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ask for high floor & room with a view.”
Reviews.Author: 5683travel
Reviews.Content: Location good for exploring the city / Darling Harbour. Near China Town. Near Monorail station. Basic, clean, kettle, fridge, good shower. Had a room with 3 beds even though I was travelling alone. I was there for 2 weeks so it was nice to have the space. Overlooked an alley though so no view & could hardly see the sky - not good for such a long stay. On 2nd floor did experience noise from night club next door @ weekends. Housekeeping & Duty Manager very friendly / helpful. Only offer breakfast but you can get cheaper / better brekkie & other meals outside the hotel very easily. Did have a cockroach in my room one night, but guess that could happen anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but a great value in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: IvyArbor
Reviews.Content: I'm not a traveler who gets too concerned with how fancy my hotel is, it just needs to be clean, safe, and in a central location. So for me, the Ibis was great. The rooms are admittedly a little on the small side, but they were very clean, had a decent sized closet, and all the little items you hope to find in a hotel room (iron, coffee pot, full length mirror, hair dryer). The beds were comfortable and the TVs got plenty of channels for the little down time we spent in the room. Which is a point I think I should stress - if you like spending time IN the hotel, this is probably not the place for you. My friend and I spent very little time at the hotel. In terms of location, the hotel is really close to a metro stop, which is really convenient, but we were also able to walk pretty easily to a lot too. In a perfect world, it would have been half a mile further north, but, burning calories is a good thing too. The area is very Asian, and there are many restaurants of that persuasion nearby. I liked this hotel, and would have no problem staying again, though would probably also check rates of hotels a tiny bit more central.

Reviews.Title: “what a let down”
Reviews.Author: kraikels
Reviews.Content: i had the chance to book a room at the Westin on Martin place for a cheaper price than the ibis, but decided to give ibis a try since i had never stayed with them before. I arrived super early in the morning from Toronto, went straight to the hotel and even thought check in time was not until 14:00 the lady at the desk said i could check in earlier as soon as a room became available. She offered me a smoking room which i had to turn down since im allergic to smoke. I waited for an hour and a half just to see two couples (male-male and female -male) just walked in and get their rooms on the spot. The girl behind the desk forgot about me and gave more rooms away even though i was sitting in front of her in the lobby. after questioning the fact that i waited for so long for the room when they actually had some available, she just didn't seem to care. handed me the key and that was the end of it. Later that night i booked the airport shuttle service from them, originally wanted to book it for 7 30 am ( it takes about an hour to get to the airport, since the shuttle stops at every other hotel in Sydney), the 7 30 shuttle wasn't available, so they gave me the 8:30..i got there around 8 :15 since they ask you to be at the lobby 10 minutes prior to scheduled pick up time. Shuttle never showed up, same girl who ignored me the day before said the shuttle was never booked ( even thought they had already taken my money) the manager Michelle was present and saw what was going on, and demanded them( the shuttle bus company) to pay for my taxi to the airport...at the end i just got my money back for the shuttle and had to take the train. Overall, a bad experience, would i stay there again ? the answer is NO.

Reviews.Title: “Great, cheap, friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: messyjessy
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time in Sydney and enjoyed our time spent at the Ibis. One thing I will say is that it is only a budget hotel so do not expect too much. We went there expecting less and came away pleasntly surprised. The staff were great, I had a problem with the aircon and I just told reception on the way out and when I came back it was fixed. The rooms are small but all we did was sleep in there anyway, we spent all our 4 days exploring. They had all the basic ammenities a hotel should have. The resturant only did breakfast but with a pub and good pub meals on every corner you didnt need to eat there anyway. One pub I will suggest is the Crown Hotel one block up best meal I had in Sydney. The selection was just fine and all the food was cooked quite well. The staff were always cleaning the tables and the place was sometimes too clean. If you get to meet the famous Theo your holiday will be even better. He always had us in stiches and was never without a smile. All the staff were fantastic. Greeting us with a smile and a hello as soon as we walked into the door. We are not really used to that. The staff obviously love their job or have excellent training. Could be a combination of both. I cannot wait to visit Sydney again and will be using the Ibis next time I stay there. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub”
Reviews.Author: swings07
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, so perhaps was given the worst room on level 2. Its the worst room because the night club next door sounds like its in your room. It went til after 4am. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only good thing”
Reviews.Author: lus76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as I was booked in for a conference. The room had already been fully booked and upon arriving they requested that I pay for the room. As it was after business hours I couldn't call my employer but I refused to pay and told them that I would get my employer to contact them first thing in the morning. As I was staying 3 nights they said this was fine. I had requested a double room and was given a twin. Room tiny, bathroom even smaller and not the cleanest... only good thing about the room was the plasma tv. Breakfast was average. I went to use the gym equipment one morning... half of it not working. On the last day, rubbish was left by the cleaners from the morning in the foyer near the lifts on my floor for over 4 hours. You had to hold your breath everytime you wanted to use the lift. Only good thing about this hotel is the location. Central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aplay58
Reviews.Content: 1 block off of George St, Close to Chinatown, Darling Harbour. Location could not have been better, also Paddy:s market. Our room #1312 was very quite and clean. 1 queen size bed and adquate closet and drawer space. Gate one had the breakfast provided to us. It was ok they just need to learn to completly cook their eggs. Would stay here if return to Sidney again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE, FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL STAFF AT IBIS WORLD SQUARE”
Reviews.Author: Gl0bewalker
Reviews.Content: I emailed the hotel earlier for early check-in possibility, so when I arrived around 8:30am the staff already noted my requirements, stored my lugguage without charge and I am given a room by 11:30am. The staff are friendly and helpful, the room is nicely sized. The bathroom is modern with all amenities. It is exactly how it looks like on their website photo. Craig in the dining room is a cheerful and helpful person, he makes my trip wonderful by giving great service. I really feel happy staying in this hotel, although it is a budget hotel, it offers good service and food. The buffet breakfast is pretty good with eggs and ham or bacon, then there is fresh fruit and juice, bread and jam. It is a hotel I highly recommended especially if you are a solo traveler, it is near to most tourist places within walking distance. The free bus 555 takes people around town and the bus stop is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: jaredhonore
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my wife and a 10 month old. Had a great welcome from staff, with a few of them showing great interest in our son and interacting with him. This continued over the 5 days. Big fish tank in the foyer which kept the little one entertained and free newspapers to keep me entertained also while waiting. Location-wise, it is across from the world square shopping centre, this has restaurants, shops, but best of all a supermarket, 1 minute walk across the road and you are there, perfect for keeping costs down. About a 20 min walk to Circular Quay, Hyde Park is a 5 minute walk away. Central station 5 minutes also. Room is on the small size, but to be expected for the good price. Big shower, lots of hot water and clean too. Flat screen TV on wall with 3 FOX sports channels, perfect when you have to be at home with your little one and the US Open tennis is on! Had a problem with aircon that was fixed by staff member. Small fridge to keep things cold, but no minibar, which we preferred as we had baby food etc to keep cold. If we go back to Sydney, we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fire alarm at 2AM!”
Reviews.Author: Chad1972
Reviews.Content: Bad things about this hotel: * Next to a night club and very noisy on a Saturday night. I didn't notice the noise any other night during my 4 night stay. * The only luggage storage available is lockers in the basement at a cost of $7 per 24 hour period. Several couples checked in ahead of me and all were told about the lockers and not one of them was happy. So much for management stating in response to previous reviews that most guests don't mind the fee. * Old, small rooms that are not maintained. There were a couple of handles missing from drawers in my room and the curtains were dirty. * No foxtel or even free to air digital channels. In room movies are $16.95. * The location feels a little bit dodgy. * I know it's out of the control of the hotel but there was a fire alarm at 2 in the morning! Good things about this hotel: * I paid $70 a night. * Despite the dodgy feel, the location is fairly central and within walking distance to most city attractions. There is a free bus that travels along George Street from Central Station to Circular Quay. Would I stay at this hotel again? Probably not. If you do want to stay in the World Square area try Rydges. It's worth the extra $$.

Reviews.Title: “Awakened by something, but not a rooster...”
Reviews.Author: Singafornian
Reviews.Content: We accidentally booked this hotel thinking that it was the Hotel Ibis at King Street Wharf, and that was a bad decision. The location was central, but not as good as King Street Wharf. But the biggest complain by far was: The walls were thin as paper! We could hear the people next door and the people outside the door as if they were right next to us. We were awakened a number of mornings by moaning and creaking coming through the thin walls. The rooms were so un-soundproof that we could hear people talking in the next rooms, and even when they weren't talking loudly in the hallway we could hear them as if they were inside the room. Also, rooms were extremely small and rather dark, you had to pay for bag storage when you checked out, and breakfast was really overpriced. Location was pretty good near Chinatown and George street - very central but with activities around at night. Front desk checked us in at 7am which was really convenient and they faxed paperwork to Singapore for free which was very helpful and almost made up for the charges for storing bags (almost...)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap place to stay, but not the best hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Amy1584
Reviews.Content: The Ibis World Square wasn't too bad when you consider the great location - close to 3 train stations (Central, Museum, and Town Hall), within walking distance of countless stores and restaurants, an easy bus ride up to Circular Quay - but it was certainly not an amazing hotel. The rooms were a decent size, but the bed was uncomfy. You get a (small!) bathroom shower instead of a tub, which gets a bit annoying if you're staying for a longer time-period. The hotel charges you to store your luggage if you arrive before check-in, and a hefty $7 at that, which we weren't too impressed about. We did the breakfast buffet one day and it was good food, but $17 per person was a lot to pay for breakfast food, we thought. If you want wireless internet it's $4 per half hour, ouch! When you consider how cheaply you can get rooms here for, though (almost as cheap as some of the backpacker hostels nearby!) it compares quite favourably to those. All in all it was ok, but we weren't overly impressed. The location and price make it worthwhile though.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom could be a lot cleaner! But ok price and location.”
Reviews.Author: cesarhanke
Reviews.Content: The room is ok, nice plasma screen for a budget hotel. Location is pretty good... and service is ok too. But what really needs some attention is the lack of cleanliness, especially in the toilet... the shower was covered in mold on the walls and floor ... in fact the shower floor should be refurbished asap.... I think you can get better stay elsewhere for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ThinController
Reviews.Content: Ibis World Square Hotel has a great Sydney location and is central to everything (and about 500 metres from Central Station). We were able to get an internet deal including a $1 breakfast, which provided great value for money. The only minor gripes were the clock radio/alarm did not work, and it was difficult to get the TV remote to work. The breakfast room is very pleasant. While only two guest lifts are provided, even with a fairly large group checking in as we were checking out there was only a minimal wait for the lift. The staff were helpful at both check in and check out, and during checkout were, at the last minute, able to get us seats on the airport shuttle bus (which was actually cheaper than using the train) - we were supposed to book several hours beforehand. Would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Where are the towels?”
Reviews.Author: 2304fish
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in an ideal location. Room was very small, we asked for 2 beds and we got 2 twin beds about 18 inches apart. The bathroom was equiped with 1 wash cloth, 1 bath mat and 2 bath towels. I asked at front desk for an additonal wash cloth/rag and the girl had no idea what I was looking for, she handed me a plastic bag, I said no, a wash cloth/rag, she handed me a note pad, I then asked if there was anyone else to speak to and she said the manager. I asked the manager for a wash rag/cloth and was told only one to a room. I asked for a face towel and was told they do not supply them. I inquired about another towel and was asked if we had 2 in the room, that was our limit, I explained I needed one for my hair and at that point I was given another towel.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about this place is the location...”
Reviews.Author: Lotty79
Reviews.Content: Location wise you can not fault this hotel, however the rooms are very small and the walls paper thin. I stayed here on two seperte occasions whilst in Australia. The first time we booked we got quite a good deal, but the second time was at much more short notice and it was expensive for what it was. Reception staff were helpful. I'd probably shop around next time, but use the Ibis at a push, because like I said at the beginning the location is very good. There are other hotels nearby that I'm sure are just as good if not better than this one though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: jaizee
Reviews.Content: This Ibis was a little bit dated in comparison to other Ibis hotels that I have stayed in. However, things were pretty clean, and it was perfectly fine. Unlike other reviewers, the location did not seem to be unsafe at all; actually, its right across the street from the World Square complex that has great restaurants, some shopping, and access to transportation (monorail is right there, the city loop is nearby at Town Hall). This location is also very walkable to the main shopping district in Sydney. One major quibble is that the internet is very expensive here! All in all, I would stay here again, but only if other hotels in this price range were booked.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC BUT CLEAN, GREAT FOR THE PRICE I PAID ON LINE”
Reviews.Author: Jackjan
Reviews.Content: Checked in well before 2pm, reception staff did some juggling around to get me a room rather than store luggage downstairs in a locker for AUD$7.00. I was going on an afternoon tour and would not be back to the hotel until well after dark. Got a room on the 6th floor, looking out over concrete buildings but that was okay, only there to sleep. Think the property is 3* but it was CLEAN and comfortable. The shower had glass door (better than those 'orrible clingy shower curtains) HOT WATER was excellent. Air conditioning was great and in the right place for me as I like to be 'cold' to sleep well. Very quiet room. No porters, very small lobby area. A couple of items needed maintenance (did not affect my comfort) I left them a note and followed up with email. Buffet breakfast on the 2nd floor was good value $17.50 (not a lot of choices but definitely enough).Good 'city scape' for photos from the breakfast room and just across the road from the World Square shops, Monorail

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel, Shame about the Internet Connection”
Reviews.Author: moominoid
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price in a great location right in the centre of the Sydney CBD. Don't expect a big room or a nice view - you're not paying for either of those at this price. The only problem was the internet connection - not cheap at $A18 per 24 hour - but less than some Australian hotels that charge $A27 - but the main problem was the connection sockets. Two sockets next to each other in the room. One had a very short ethernet cable that could not be removed and the other was disabled (as confirmed by the staff at reception). I always bring an extra long ethernet cable with me so I can work sitting on the bed or wherever in the room but this just wasn't possible because of this silly setup. I guess I should have brought my wireless router from home... The hotel should enable the second socket or better yet provide wireless internet at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ybyd
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Ibis hotel and while not the cheapest you can find (which is why I have given it four stars not five) it is well run with excellent rooms and a corking shower (important after a long day's sight-seeing in my opinion). The lobby is small but efficiently run by friendly, helpful staff and the location is second to none being easily accessible for CBD and Circular Quays (free bus) plus the nightlife around Surry Hills and Darlinghurst. Close to all modes of transport and being in back packer area loads of great food and drink deals all around it. Check out the Â£1 steak and Â£2 Sunday dinners at the nearby Shark Bar - bonza! Having a crap hotel room can affect your holiday; having a decent one makes for a much better one. Ibis appears to understand that here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: KimiItalia
Reviews.Content: Easy access to public transport. Close to shops, monorail and light rail. Beds great, sheets good, shower good few problems with water pressue but for the price was quite impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Ani
Reviews.Content: We booked through Accor for $109 a night for a twin room but upgraded to a triple room when we had an extra traveller join us. They actually managed to give us three beds, which was completely unexpected and that room was very roomy. Regardless, the value was outstanding compared to what we would have paid for other hotels in the CBD, paricularly to fit three people. The twin room was quite small but sufficient for a traveller who isn't spending a lot of time in their room. Cleaning was very good and location was outstanding. We were well aware that the hotel was not actually in World Square as we Googled the hotel before booking, but it's across the road. Reception staff were courteous and friendly and very helpful, particularly when we thought we had lost a diamond earring in the shower! The only real downside was that there is a noisy pub next door which closed at about 5am on the Saturday (we didn't hear it any other night). We could probably only hear it as we were on the third floor whereas we started on the 17th floor. Also, be prepared to pay $7 for a locker for your luggage if you arrive too early for check in.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed with the Ibis”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for one night upon arrival in Sydney from Canada. I have to say, after staying at numerous Ibis hotels in Europe I was not impressed with this one. I have usually found the Ibis hotels to be basic yet super clean. The room I was given needed an extremely cleaning. The carpet was filthy, the walls were all marked, the bathroom was not as clean as it should have been and the bed sheets had stains on them. There are plenty of other economical accomodations in the area, I would not stay at this Ibis again.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis World Square Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 384 Pitt Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
